1.author: JonB
1.review:
I purchased a TV and needed better sound. I also read all the reviews that said the clarity of people talking is better using this speaker, which is what we were really looking for. Here is the review.

Pro:The best clarity occurs when you activate the speaker into the voice enhanced or dialog mode by pressing a special button on the remote. As stated in other reviews, it makes a very positive enhancement in clarity of all voices on all programs. But there is a catch that you should be aware of.

Con: The enhanced clarity dialog mode stays active only as long as you are watching at that particular time. Which means that if you turn off the TV, the speaker reverts back to the normal audio mode which is much less enhanced. Additionally, if you set the speaker in auto sense mode, where it comes on by itself when it notices you have turned the TV on, you still need to find the remote for the speaker and activate the enhanced audio mode by pressing the special dialog button every time. If the TV has only been off a short time, then the speaker won't revert to normal mode. But if its off for any longer than an hour, it will always revert to the standard sound mode. Our hearing is not good so we would much rather have the speaker stay in the enhanced audio function every time.
I called Bose customer care at 800-792-7197 ext 54464 and they confirmed the speaker does reset every time. They said most of their other systems stay in the mode you put it in and don't revert. They said if enough people call and ask them to adjust this, they will consider a firmware update to allow it to stay in dialog mode if you put it there. (there is a usb port on the back of the speaker and the tech said that the speaker could get a firmware update in that manner if they choose to create one)

Overall the speaker has very good mid range sound and decent bass as well, but you should be aware that for the enhanced dialog voice mode you will need to have the speaker remote handy to activate it each time or else you will get the standard sound. As a note, I was not able to get my learning remote to "learn" the dialog button frequency and assign it to a button.

On the other hand, if you want to call Bose and ask them to consider providing the option to keep the enhanced dialog mode active until you want to shut it off, give them a call on the number above. Hope that helps.
1.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

2.author: RobertNY
2.review_title: Great Product, Universal Remote is Advanced Setup
2.review:
Full disclosure, I did a ton of research leading into this:
- Sounds quality issues are either defective unit or setup based. Once set up, the sound quality is honestly impeccable for a pure sound bar.
- Installation, from out of the box to connecting wires, took me 4.5 minutes - and I timed it to make a point to my wife (love you honey :).
- The Universal Remote: It really requires a capital 'The' because while it is by FAR the most advanced component Universal Remote I have ever seen, it takes advanced setup. I have 2 engineering degrees and it took me 4 hours to understand how to program and then actually do it.

PROGRAMMING THE UNIVERSAL REMOTE (If you have any questions, here is how I did it)
- To understand why each brand has only one Code, it is because under each brand (Samsung, Vizio, etc.) there may be multiple SUB-codes, any one of which may work for your device, so it will be time consuming. For example, for Samsung, I discovered through trial and error, there are approximately 30 sub-codes.

To find the right one for your component, you enter the code per the instructions, then press volume + ONCE and wait till it is set, then you test per the instructions. If responsive, great! If not try again up to the volume +, then you press volume + TWICE, then test, if not - then follow the process over this time volume + THREE (FOUR, FIVE, SIX) so on and so forth until it responds.

I am sure the brilliant team at BOSE would have told me this had I been able to get someone on the phone on a Saturday afternoon, and possibly they have a better method, but this is how I did it and I was able to add 4 components all of different levels of age and complexity.

The directions could use some fine-tuning. That is my only knock and why I go down to 4 starts. Let's call it punitive incentivization in that, had I left for my 75 year old father to set up, he would not be talking to me till the holidays, but the 4 hours kept me from having to go to BedBathBeyond with my wife - so I could make it 4.5 stars - but baby steps.

Once up and running though, I couldn't imagine going back to the receiver component systems I was running. Love the BOSE SOLO 5 so far!
2.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

3.author: Toddk
3.review:
Purchased my Bose Solo 5 to enhance TV audio experience. I use my TV to watch "traditional cable" and also "stream" movies, IHeart Radio and Pandora for music. This is the single entertainment device on the primary floor of the house.

The Bose Solo 5 interfaced with my "low end" Sony LCD flat screen via "optical cable" The Bose Solo 5 was easily programed into my Xfinity Remote. This was painless... Bose unit turns on an off with the TV and cable box. 

I don't play music or TV shows loudly (I'm Married.. enough said) The Bose Solo 5 has met every objective I had for the everyday use intended. (I do have my separate man cave in the basement with the full monty setup the Bose Solo 5 is not in that room... the Bose Solo 5 is on the residence primary floor for everyday viewing/listening.

I mounted the Bose Solo 5 under my Sony TV which is wall mounted via swing arm mount. I manufactured my own sound bar mount using simple angle iron, painted black and trimmed. See pic. The sound quality is excellent for the $250 price point. Bass is surprisingly good for unit without separate sub. The bass is adjustable via remote too.

The Bose Solo 5 also has Blue tooth option for use with phone's or pc's. This works as expected.

One negative... the Bose supplied optical cable was faulty out of the box and frankly could have been better quality if it had worked.
3.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

4.author: Karin
4.review: I purchased this Bose soundbar to replace a Philips 5 speaker surround sound system. Bose sound bar is super easy to set up. Pulled it out of the box, connected the power cord and digital sound cable. Then paired the universal remote with my Samsung TV as shown on page 16 of the Owner's Guide. Sound and remote functions are working perfectly with DIRECTV. You can get to your recorded shows in DIRECTV by pushing the "menu" button on the remote. Push "guide" to get to DirecTV guide. It's that easy. You can easily record a show by pushing the red dot "record" button on the remote. (This doubles as the "delete" function when deleting shows from your recordings list...so be careful there) I did adjust the bass sound exactly as the instructions show on page 18 of the Owner's Guide for movies. The bass maxes out and does not provide bass sound like Pioneer car speakers, but it does have extremely clear sound and enough bass to my liking in my large living room. (400+ sq feet). As other reviewers have mentioned, right under the "bass" button, there is a "dialogue" button to press for extra voice clarity on regular dialogue programs. I turn it on immediately when I turn on the remote if I want decreased bass for news, talk shows, or regular programs. You can easily play music from iPhone by turning on Bluetooth on iphone, pressing Bluetooth icon at the top of the Bose remote - the speaker immediately pairs. (You will hear a beep and see a blue light flashing and know that it is paired) Then play a tune from phone and adjust volume from either the remote or phone. Sound clarity is excellent. Again, I adjusted the bass to highest setting, and while this still isn't a party thumping type of bass sound, it completely fills room with beautiful sound. I will be using the speaker often to listen to my tunes at a medium to low sound without shaking the walls. Overall, I love the ease of use and clear sound. Would definitely recommend this soundbar if you are looking for easy setup and Bose quality sound at a fraction of the price for full Bose surround.
4.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

5.author: jrpitt
5.review:
Long time Bose customer. Part of what has made them one of my go to's when considering speakers is simplicity along with the quality of sound. This item certainly delivers on both. One speaker, simple setup, incredible sound! I bought this as a Christmas gift for my parents to accompany their 55" Samsung TV. They would never go for a system that has a sub as they'd not care for the deep bass. Their hearing isn't as great as it once was and one key feature with this soundbar is the dialogue clarity. It makes a noticeable difference even for them when watching TV. They also appreciate that sound is better and much more clear than from the TV speaker. In short, they are thrilled with this product and that makes me very happy. 

My personal opinion: It fills the room with rich, clear sound. You can hear a full range of sound from this impressive little speaker system. Setup was simple. Optical connection from TV into the soundbar, power on the soundbar. That's it. Make sure to adjust your TV's settings to Audio Out and you'll be enjoying sound from the Solo 5. The remote was a little tricky, as I've still not found a code that would allow me to turn on TV and cable box with Bose remote. I'll work on that with Bose Tech Support. In the short term, I was able to use the remote from the cable box to power on the Solo 5 so that works. Truthfully that's probably easier for my parents as they're used to the cable box's remote. 

I enjoyed the Solo 5 so much that I'm considering adding one for my bedroom TV as it takes up very little space, but produces incredible sound! There are likely cheaper options out there, but the Solo 5 is well worth a look if you're looking for a single soundbar.
5.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

6.author: Wwerno
6.review_title: Great sound for the size. Easy to use.
6.review:
This review does not provide any technical detail. 
Purchased this unit for use in a den area that’s 14ft by 10ft. Primary reason for buying a sound bar was to get better vocal sound while watching movies since some flat screen TVs have awful sound. 
Settled on the Bose Solo 5 given its size, quality of sound, ease of use and the fact that a bass module unit is not needed. 
Setup was quick and easy. Instructions were easy to follow. We were up and running with the Bose sound bar within a few minutes. 
We thoroughly enjoy using this unit. It provides good clarity on vocal sound and is easy to hear even when setting a low volume on the sound bar. 
The unit comes with a remote that can be set up as the cable box remote if needed, but we don’t use that function. We turn the unit on and off as and when required.
The sound bar also connects to mobile devices via Bluetooth. This is proving to be a good option since we can use the speaker to play music etc from a mobile device or PC that supports Bluetooth. The sound is great even for music and we’ve since retired the stereo and computer speakers used so far. 
Other reviews on this unit appear to show differing opinions on whether this unit is any good or not. In our experience it is good. The design and build quality feels great. Some of our other Bose products are now more than 14 years old and still working really well. We expect this unit will probably give us a great service life.
6.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

7.author: infinitehorizon
7.review_title: Helpful aid for the hearing impaired
7.review:
I bought this soundbar for my mother who, according to audiology testing, has severe loss in the high frequency range and moderate loss in the lower frequencies - she can't hear many consonants so "sand, band, fanned, panned, canned " etc all sound like "and". Funny thing is that when conversing with her you don't need to speak loudly, but when watching the TV she needs the volume cranked way high. She refuses to get a hearing aid mostly out of vanity but also because she can usually figure out what you're saying by context; only occasionally do I have to write the word that she can't hear. Anyway, after a quick and easy set up, she immediately noticed a significantly improved clarity to conversations and that was before we entered the dialog mode which improved the spoken words a little more. With this soundbar she has a much more enjoyable tv viewing experience as she doesn't have to struggle decipher conversations (both in English and her native Asian language) and everyone else benefits because she doesn't have the volume cranked up so high, though it's still louder than what the non-hearing challenged would require. 
This soundbar is definitely helpful for someone with high frequency loss who refuses a hearing aid; it is well worth its price.
7.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

8.author: V4WIN
8.review:
Recently I purchased Projector and I was looking around for a nice Sound Bar which gives Dialogue Clarity along with exact background instrument sounds, Tried different Brand 5.1 channel , 2.1 channel many different brands..some how i am not satisfied, but in almost all other sound system i commonly noticed one thing...Dialogue clarity. But finally I own after buying this product, This is what I am expecting from sound bar, any sound system gives drums and beats, i say those are very important...but at the same dialogue clarity also very important. Thanks to Bose ! 

If you are looking for excellent sound system with affordable cost. Then Please close your eyes and buy this. You will enjoy like me. Of course if you are looking for big surround sound system and booms..then this is not the product.

Here are the high level details -

Box:
The Sound bar,Universal remote, optical and coaxial cables, adapter, manuals. 

Installation:
Super Easy. put the plug in the power adapter and the sound bar and cable into device.

The universal remote takes a little more time. Especially if you do not understand how it works. But the manual helps.

Build quality:
The build quality is excellent, the soundbar feels solid through the metal speaker grill and the plastic on top. All connections run deep into the sound bar so when he hangs up connections are still accessible.

Bluetooth works great. No issues or drops at all. Very nice.

Sound Quality : Profession quality.
8.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

9.author: IMHO
9.review:
This soundbar shows that bigger isn't always *that* much better. Picked up the soundbar to replace a much larger soundbar+subwoofer setup I had before which was totally overkill for our small living room. Really very pleased with the quality of the sound. 

The dialogue is very clear - and the dialogue function works well by boosting the treble and dialing back the bass to make words more clear. The sound is surprisingly full, crisp and clear. The bass is clean and tight, but not overpowering. The speaker also allows for very precise and fine tuning of volume - so you can adjust to get the volume just right. Sounds great playing music as well and TV and movies. 

Here are the things to keep in mind: 
* The bass is clear and clean - but keep your expectations in check. But this soundbar isn't going to shake the windows. If you want bass that rattles your chest, this isn't for you. The bass, again is adequate. But if you want your house to shake, you'll probably want a separate sub.
* The remote is disappointing. The remote is big, heavy and clunky and kinda poorly designed. It stands out like a sore thumb - especially compared with the sleek speaker. The remote seems like an afterthought. I would have preferred a small thin device to just control the speaker itself - instead of this clumsy, universal remote. 
* No on-speaker controls. My older soundbar had volume controls on the speaker itself. That was handy. Not the case with this one - you need the remote for most functions (although it does have auto turn on and auto turn off). There is also no visual indicator of the volume level. 
Overall - a fantastic speaker. It is so much smaller than what I had before and the sound is great - especially for the size. The control is OK - but ugly and clunky. It would also be cool if the speaker allowed to you add a subwoofer in the future if you wanted to.
9.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

10.author: PatrickIAH
10.review:
I currently live in a 622 sq. foot apartment, and recently got a 48" TV with HORRIBLE sound distortion issues. The seating area of my living room is 12'x12', so I wanted a soundbar without a separate sub-woofer to have to find a place for. Also, being that I'm in an apartment I don't want to disturb my neighbors by watching TV or listening to music at wall rattling volume, so I saw no point in investing $700 or more on a unit that I wouldn't be able to fully utilize anyway. Finally, I wanted to buy from a brand known for sound equipment, not one that specializes in video but puts out soundbars on the side.

This soundbar is exactly what I wanted! The first thing I watched was a documentary about Cambodian rock & roll in the 1950's through 1970's. The film has music running almost constantly, even behind most of the interviews. Without the soundbar the distortion was so bad that the movie was basically unwatchable. But now, no problems at all! I haven't taken the volume up all the way yet, because of the neighbor issue, so I'm not sure how loud it will get. I figure I'll try one afternoon while everyone else is out at work. I've been using the Bluetooth feature to listen to music and have no problem hearing it in any of the other rooms. I figure that when I eventually buy a house and have a larger living room and no neighbors to disturb, I will move this one into the bedroom and a get Bose with more power and features to replace it. But for now, this suits my needs perfectly.
10.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

11.author: Horace1990
11.review:
The Bose Solo 5 TV Soundbar produces very good sound. Easier to understand and considerably deeper or more nuanced than sound from the Samsung flat screen TV's own speakers. It is a definite improvement - not a $1000 improvement, but a considerable step up. The sound is also more than adequate when playing music from my smart phone via Bluetooth. Could have more bass, but the room is small and our interest in deep, loud thumping is small as well. Reviews by others that pointed to sound clarity and not too much bass were accurate. 

Reviews that spoke to ease of set-up were also accurate -- except about programming the Bose universal remote to handle our other equipment. This was more or less a failure, despite several attempts that scrupulously followed the instructions both in the manual and in others' reviews, which very helpful (why can't Bose do this straight up?) . So the downer is that I now have yet another remote, my LARGEST by far - this one to handle sound only, while I use the satellite system remote to operate the satellite box and some TV functions, the TV remote to access online programming, and a Blu-Ray remote to operate that unit. Pain in the neck. It would be much better if Bose (or someone) could make an add-on that could be paired into an original equipment manufacturer's system. Or, failing that, made a much smaller remote, if it's going to be (for many users) one of several.
11.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

12.author: raqball
12.review:
I live in a condo and have a small sized living room. Previous to purchasing this I have just been using the flat screen TV's internal speakers. I wanted something a step up from them but since I live in a condo I did not want wall and floor shaking bass.

The Solo 5 sounds awesome compared to my flat screen TV's internal speakers. There is a decent amount of bass from the unit but not to the point of wall rattling. I find the bass from it to be more than acceptable. 

The unit is fairly small and setup took all of about 2 minutes. Plug into the wall, insert batteries into remote and attach the optical cable. Done!

The remote is LARGE and I probably won't use it but it does work well and I even programmed it to control my Apple TV (4th Gen).. 

Overall I am very happy with the purchase. If you are looking for wall shaking bass then this unit is not for you. If you want a reasonably priced sound bar that sounds leaps and bounds better than a TV's internal speakers then this might be for you..
12.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

13.author: Barstad05
13.review:
Like everything “Bose”, the package is small in comparison to the competition, but they always dress to impress. I was looking for something small for one of our non-movie-theater style rooms. I just wanted a sound bar, no additional subwoofer or surround speakers, so I thought I would give the Solo 5 a shot (as I’ve had a few other Bose sound bars over the years, and they all delivered beautifully).

The Solo 5 offers a nice clear and crisp presentation. If you are a bass enthusiast, then this is certainly not the sound bar for you. If you seek a well balanced sound bar with just the right amount of punch, then I would highly recommend giving this little guy a try. It has a center channel speaker, right and left front channel speakers, and one more on each end that bounce sound off the walls. It’s actually quite impressive for its size and not having an additional sub or surround speakers. In fact, the biggest selling point for me (aside from the sound), was that it is about 1/2 the size of its competitors.

To sum it up, if your looking for something extra aside from just the tv speakers, but you don’t want a large hunk of a sound bar, then this is your best bet for the money. Bose always delivers, and I would recommend this product to everyone.
13.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

14.author: JplofVt
14.review_title: Does what it was designed to do
14.review:
I was tired of having to use closed captions to watch certain shows. Rewinding because you didn't hear something clearly. This unit takes care of the problem. It has a button that will specifically enhance speech even though in its default mode it works perfectly. For those who like additional bass there is a mode that allows you to increase the bass. 

I was really impressed with the remote. It can pretty much do everything my Xfinity remote can do except for the buttons that light up. 
Now if your looking for surround sound effect or big sound this is not for you. Yes it does have an overall better sound, but not at a level found 
with other center speaker units. 
It's easy to set up. I connected to my tv with the optical cable. You can also connect via Bluetooth or RCA cable there is also an aux port. No 
HDMI.?
I've read a couple of reviews that weren't favorable to the fact that if your in the dialogue mode and shut the unit off it will turn back on in the default mode. It's really no biggie. Certainly not a deal breaker.
So if your like me and have some hearing loss and don't hear speech as clearly as you once did, look no further.
14.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

15.author: JerryH
15.review: I purchased the Bose Solo 5 today. It was very easy to set up with only a power cable and digital cable. I could tell right away there was a huge improvement from the TV speakers. The bass is easy to adjust and there is a dialogue button that turns the bass off when it isn't needed. The bass doesn't have the power of a separate sub woofer but living in an apartment I don't need it to shake the walls. The remote is cool. It's about and inch longer than a standard DirecTV remote. It was simple to program and now controls my Sharp TV and DirecTV receiver. It turns both and the soundbar on/off at the same time and controls everything on the DirecTV receiver ( Menu, channel guide, DVR, channel up/down) Pairing the Bose Solo 5 with my blue tooth device was also simple. I put on some IHeart radio and the Bose sound really came through. It was awesome! The only problem I've had is when I disconnected the blue tooth, the sound bar continued searching for a connection and I couldn't get it to return to TV sound. I had to turn it off and back on. I'm sure this is operator error. It looks great and sounds great. Very happy with my purchase!
15.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

16.author: Spence
16.review:
I probably didn't need this unit since every top of the line TV will come with some pretty decent speakers built in...but here we are with this review.

High quality sound, and I really like the volume settings - the difference between each level is very small, which allows you to precisely choose the exact level of volume you'd like. Nice design too, and looks great sitting in front of my TV.

Downside is that the co-axial line that connects the sound bar to your TV isn't very stable - if you like to put your soundbar in front of your TV, it will get loose over time as you adjust things, and you may have to re-insert the co-axial from time to time. It's bluetooth capable, so I might try just hooking it up to my TV that way...but a more secure co-axial connection would have been nice. Additionally, the remote is rather large for a soundbar - it's like 6 times the size of my smart TV remote. I don't want to control my TV with my soundbar remote, especially when the TV has it's own smart remote. But that's just me nitpicking for flaws.

To be honest, the price I paid for this unit makes it not worthwhile to the thrifty shopper who already plans on getting a top-of-the-line TV. But if you're something of a perfectionist like me, its worth it. And it'll last you a long time.
16.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

17.author: Hellonwheels
17.review_title: Improved sound.No help with dialog comprehension.
17.review: Bought this for my 40" Sony flat screen tv. Reason I bought it is because my elderly mother, who wears in-ear hearing aids couldn't understand what was being said on tv. (She understands what people talking to her are saying and she has had the hearing aids over a year so she has adjusted to them.) Sound bar did not improve that situation at all even when I selected the "dialogue" mode. Not much difference between the bass and dialogue modes but the dialogue mode is slightly clearer for understanding what is being said. I turned off the Sony sound when I installed the Bose as the manual suggested. If I had known that the Bose sound bar wouldn't help my mother understand what was being said on tv, I probably wouldn't have purchased this. I can tell that it has improved the audio of my tv but not sure it is worth spending that amount of money since I could hear the tv pretty well before installing the sound bar. Wish I could have compared the Bose to the other brands of sound bars--I only went with the Bose because the reviews indicated that the dialogue mode was a big help in understanding what was being said on tv. This one cost more than some others and I don't know if it is really worth the extra money or not. So I'm a bit on the fence as to whether I would recommend this to a friend. But I will select "yes" because it has improved the audio of my tv--just not to the extent that it addressed my reason for the purchase.
17.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

18.author: JKJR
18.review_title: Great sound bar in size and performance!
18.review: Very easy to set up right out of the box. All cables and and connections needed are included. Well designed remote control that will really allow you to consolidate all the other remotes in your system. (tv, cable box, and dvd player), Was looking for a compact soundbar system with a minimal amount of equipment for set up, a reasonable foot print, and capable of creating minimal clutter. Upon first set-up I must admit I was a bit disappointed in the level of the sound volume. After a quick call to Boise customer support I was instructed to connect the soundbar optical cable to my cable box instead of the television itself. That's was the trick. What a big difference. Now I have ample sound and a lot more volume. I am sure that there are more elaborate systems out there with sub woofers and additional speakers. However, this well manufactured Boise provides plenty of great sound for this consumer. Highly recommend.
18.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

19.author: PiousPete
19.review:
The soundbar was easy to set up. The sound is clear and rich and I like it very much. I understand why the best buy rating currently stands at 4.5. 
So why have I given a one star rating? The universal remote control!
So what's wrong with it? Not much. In fact, I quite like it: it's one of the best universal remotes that I have ever had. So what's my beef? The "back button" doesn't work with Samsung Smart TVs. Is this a big deal? In one respect no - there are work arounds and I still use the Universal Remote. But occasionally, you manage to get into some hole in Netflix or YouTube which you just can't get out of without the back button. So there's no choice but to get of your big fat you-know-what to switch everything off and on again.
Is this a first-world problem? You betcha. But here's the thing: I live in the first world and I expect such daft design oversights to be addressed.
Myself and a merry band of fellow travellers have been complaining about this to Bose on their customer support website for over a year now, and nothing has been done about it. I'm not even convinced that Bose has yet accepted that there is problem to be fixed. What little feedback we have got has been PR wishy-washy to say the least.
19.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

20.author: Sierra88
20.review:
This soundbar is perfect for someone who does not desire to have a subwoofer. In my case I needed a soundbar for my TV on my patio but did not want a subwoofer sitting on the ground that occasionally gets wet and would just be in the way.

Installation is very easy. I bought a bracket that attached to my TV mount and installed the Bose Soundbar flush with the TV. It appears that the speaker is a part of the TV. The sound difference is incredible compared to a regular TV speakers. I am very pleased with the bass as well. You can add more bass using the remote control.

What really was a win is my original plan was to install speakers on my patio and hang them on the wall. I wanted to not only get better sound from my TV I needed to play music on my patio. This gives you both without all the clutter.

Having this placed in a large patio area with only one wall behind it proves the bass response is superior. I am certain if this was placed in a smaller room the sound would be even better.

Way to go Bose!
20.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

21.author: leerod
21.review_title: finally a great price for great sound
21.review: This is a really cool addition to your TV. It's the first Bose speaker I have ever purchased to replace my TV speaker bc it is so affordable. Now don't be mistaken...this is not one of those fancier, surround sound set ups. This is a really straightforward, enhanced TV speaker. The clarity is way better where I can actually hear conversations going on that aren't muffled. Music sounds like music! And the balance is just so much better than what you get out of your TV alone. The cool thing is that this speakers lets you connect to Bluetooth with 2 devices at the same time! You can have a music war with your friends going back and forth! Lol. I purchased this right away when I saw the price point bc hello, it's Bose! Awesome little dude for my living room. And you can mount it! Even better. Super simple set up too. Optical to my TV and then power connection. Voila. You're done.
21.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

22.author: Ford
22.review_title: This is not a Surround Sound System
22.review:
As long as you understand what you are getting with the Solo 5 you'll be happy with it. It is not like most soundbars, it does not even try to mimic Surround Sound and it doesn't have subwoofer to deliver a lot of bass. What it does is improve upon your TVs speakers and make voices much easier to understand. For me this was a big plus. It can also be used as a a Bluetooth speaker for music which I find convenient.

However the best thing about the Solo 5 is the Universal remote that comes with it. It is the best I ever had, it even works with my TiVo. What makes it so good is it has a lot of selections so it will do more than adjust the volume on your TV, it makes it easy to open the TV menu because it has dedicated menu button.

If you like Bose speakers, which never produce a lot of bass, you'll be happy with the Solo system. The high quality remote is an added plus.
22.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

23.author: BradleyDY
23.review_title: Great sound for the price and the size
23.review:
I purchased this item due to the size of the area that it had to be installed in which was under 35 inches. It seemed that every other sound bar I looked at was a minimum of 35.5 to 36 inches wide so my options were very limited.

It took me longer to get this item out of the box than it did to get it hooked up and working. I've read several reviews that complain about the difficulty with setup and I have a 43 inch Sony Bravia and it worked as soon as it was power up. The setup could NOT have been any easier. 

PROS
1. I do like the dialogue option that lets you quickly change the setting when you're watching the news or weather and you need to hear the voices more than the overall sound.

2. When watching movies this little sound bar really puts out some BIG sound. I was really surprised in a good way.

Cons
The only thing that comes to mind is the fact that you can't add a sub woofer or any other wired or wireless speaker/speakers. However, it is a Bose and I paid less than $250 so that's not really a big surprise considering what I paid. I cheaped out and got a great sounding sound bar but ti's not expandable and I knew that when I bought it so I am not complaining.
23.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

24.author: JJDDSS
24.review: I'm sure everyone has experienced the sensation of not being able to hear characters talk on movies or shows but music and explosions or gunfire sound like you're at Glastonbury or downtown Baltimore. And you're constantly adjusting the volume up and down to not disturb your neighbors. Pain in the neck. I'd tried a soundbar before but it created issues with the TV and I had to return it. But struggling with it again I thought I'd try a different brand. Walked all through Best Buy looking at them. I didn't really want a big subwoofer like the last one I had. I'm in an apartment building and I have manners so not trying to blast people out of the building. I just want to be able to hear the characters on Game of Thrones divulge important information without turning the volume up to 100. Anyway, this thing was tucked away in the very last aisle and I was about to leave the store with nothing. But this was very compact, not overly expensive, and I've had good experiences with Bose headphones so thought I'd give it a shot. I'm glad I did. It works great. Everything sounds better and is more balanced than the TV speakers. Plus the bar isn't taking up tons of room. Just sitting under the TV discreetly. Love it.
24.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

25.author: technohuh
25.review: I bought this to replace an older soundbar that was not bluetooth, but, has a subwoofer. This BOSE soundbar has an integrated subwoofer, which I know does not deliver bass sound as well as a separate one. This hooked up easily and works well, but, it just does not offer enough bass sound, no matter how many times you try to turn it up. The dialogue is nice and clear, and can be enhanced by the "dialogue" option, which actually lowers the bass so background music is less prominent. But, the overall sound quality was not rich enough for me, and much less than I expected from a BOSE product. However, when I paired it w/my IPhone to listen to music, the music was very nice. It just didn't suit my main purpose thought, so, returned it. I think it would work very well in a bedroom environment, because you don't want bass booming around in the walls in bwtn bedrooms. You can keep the volume down enough not to travel, but, it will still be clear enough to hear very well.
25.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

26.author: Frezia
26.review_title: News or Music - Options on Remote
26.review:
Hi Everyone, just wanted to add some details regarding the options/clarity switching between music/movies and the news/talk shows. Unfortunately Bose does not do justice to market it's own options. These are nice features should be images to call attention to them right on the box.
TO ADJUST BASE
When looking at the universal remote included you can change bass by pushing the TV button on the remote until all 6 buttons on the top row lit up, wait 3 (not two) green flashes on the speaker then push BASS and adjust up, down on VOLUME button.
TO SITCH FROM MUSIC/MOVIES TO NEWS, TALK SHOWS
Use the BUBBLE icon underneath the Bass button. The sounds will become much clearer for words when using this option.
It would be great if Best Buy Associate would call attention to this as well.
26.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

27.author: skymaster
27.review: The advertised "easy set up" (confirmed by some customers) is true only in SOME cases. Depends on your TV. I bought the Bose Solo 5 and attempted to connect it to my (relatively new) Sony Bravia Digital TV (a very popular model TV) and couldn't. Spent (believe it or not) over four hours trying to troubleshoot the problem with 3 different Bose customer service representatives in Manila before finally giving up and returning the product. Could not get the Solo 5 to sync with my TV...no sound produced. Tried everything, even running back to the store for a new optical cable because one of the product specialists believed it to be a defective cable...which was incorrect. Probably the most frustrating experience of trying to hook up an electronic product in my life. One of their "specialists" suggested I send the product to a service center for repair (though I had purchased it only 4 hours earlier!) All-in-all a terrible experience.
27.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

28.author: Spud14901
28.review:
I read 100's of reviews on sound bars. I bought this for my new LG 60" TV and didn't expect miracles. I have a high end JBL sound system on my other LG TV. I bought Bose as everybody knows they make a quality product. The sound on the Solo 5 is rich but the bar is lacking volume. I am in a 12 X 16 room and the TV and sound bar are facing me and the bar is just in front of the TV. The volume is adequate at best. The basic speakers on the LG 6300 have a tinny sound and the Solo 5 takes care of that.
Then there is the fact that there are no controls or lights on the bar. There is one light that flickers when you change the volume but there is no way of knowing where on the scale you are. When you press the voice enhancement button on the remote, you do not know if it is on or off. I cannot even tell that there is a difference when I press it. If you are looking for just a 50% increase in sound quality over the standard built in TV speakers, this should satisfy you. This system was a disappointment to me.
28.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

29.author: massasauga423
29.review:
The Bose Solo 5 sound bar is even better than I expected. Our TV's speakers really weren't doing the job and the sound was so bad I thought I was having hearing problems. 

The sound bar really puts out clear sound and it makes speech extremely clear. My hearing isn't so bad after all!

The remote control that comes with the sound bar is easily programable; I can turn the soundbar, TV, and DVR on or off with one touch of a button. I can also control these components as well as my DVD player individually from the same remote, if I need to.

I've seen a couple of reviews criticizing the bass from this soundbar. The bass doesn't shake the walls and the floor, but I think it is adequate for my living room (certainly much better bass than from the TV speakers, with no buzz)

I am really glad I bought this product.
29.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

30.author: GaryE90000
30.review: This Bose speaker is a major improvement over the speakers in your tv. This speaker is compact and will blend- in to the room plus it comes with a wonderful remote control. This speaker will not shake and rock your whole house. For that you need a more powerful speaker and subwoofer. This Bose speaker can be used with your desktop computer as well. It would mate up good with a 23 inch or larger pc monitor. In summary, this speaker has good sound quality and I can finally understand the dialog from news and various tv dramas. The speaker comes with a 3 foot long fiber output cable that connects from the tv sound out to the rear of the Bose speaker. There are two more connection options, coax and rca left and right jacks. Rumor has it the fiber output is superior in sound quality then the other two options.
30.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

31.author: Bryce
31.review_title: Great for those hard of hearing
31.review:
I got a new tv but the sound on the newer thin TVs have horrible sound. The sound has to be way up in order to hear. I’m hard of hearing and have a hard time with making out the words spoken while watching a program. With this sound bar not only does the sound come from the front on the tv now (placing the bar under the stand and in front of tv) you can adjust the bass so I can now get rid of the higher register sounds that made it impossible to know what was being said without having to use closed caption. It also comes with a wonderful universal remote that I have yet to explore all it can do. 
I highly recommend this item and the maker Bose has a great reputation for high quality products. Sure you can probably find cheaper sound bars but if you want high performance I’d go with this one. Well worth he price.
31.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

32.author: Lindy1357
32.review: The Bose Solo 5 is not perfect but almost. I needed a compact soundbar, and the Solo 5 is exactly the right size. Connecting the unit was a breeze--just a power cord and an optical audio cord. The output is very good for both music and speech. Setting up the universal remote to work with Dish was not overly complicated. Even though I gave it a 5star rating, I would like to mention several features that could be better: 1) There is no digital readout for volume. 2) There is no digital readout for the bass level, and it's just a more bass/less bass toggle. 3) There is no way to adjust the treble level at all. 4) I can't get the closed-captioning button to work, so I have to use the Dish remote to enable this feature. I am quite happy with this purchase.
32.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

33.author: jamegrl
33.review: I read as much about the Bose Solo 5 and reviews as I possibly could before I decided to purchase it, (which I am one of those consumers who researches most everything I buy especially in electronics) I understand some buyers were disappointed thinking they were getting your typical sound bar with surround, however if you do your homework you will realize the Bose solo 5 is strictly to enhance the sound of your TV and that it does in spades!! My 65" Samsung now sounds as you would expect a big screen TV to sound. I do have a separate surround sound system I use when I want that theater effect, but for everyday programming and even Netflix or Amazon Original programs I find much more enjoyable to listen to thru my Bose. Another perk the Remote control does in fact run everything in sync TV, Cable and Bose all on at the same time, and bluetooth works perfect sounds great! If you want to enjoy listening to your TV this is for you, if you want simulated surround sound this is NOT for you, although you will hear things from your TV like never before and the sound is wide.
33.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

34.author: Mianster
34.review_title: Fills the Room w/o a Dedicated Sub
34.review: First, I admit that I'm partial to Bose. The first time I heard the desktop speakers at a friends home years ago, I couldn't believe how it was so atmospheric that I immediately went out and purchased them (not an easy bill to swallow at $400). After purchasing a new 4k TV for our small home, I needed something that would be compelling for movies and gaming and this tiny sound bar without a dedicated subwoofer is fantastic. Great build quality. In fairness, my wife and I tested every sound bar in Best Buy with local staff. In the end, this was the best value for our space and quality of sound is what I expect for Bose. If you can afford this, you won't be disappointed...well maybe with how complex the remote settings are. My advice, hear it on display at Best Buy and hear for yourself. Cheers.
34.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

35.author: Irfan
35.review_title: Bose® - Solo 5 TV Soundbar - Black - Review
35.review: I choose this specific Bose Sound bar compared to other sound bars because the price ($250) was reasonable for the quality of sound. I did not want to spend too much on sound bars. Having a sound bar makes a big difference since big flat screen TVs sound quality is pretty bad, no matter how good the flat screen TV is. For a reasonable living room size (2 bedroom apt), this sound bar does a great job. Very easy to setup and hookup to your TV. Remote control definitely helps. Playing/Streaming music wireless from the iPhone is really helpful and sound from the Sound bar makes a world of difference for the music. So far, I like this and all my family members feel the difference when they are watching the TV. It is a different feeling when watching the TV with this sound bar.
35.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

36.author: Mikeymikes1971
36.review: I researched several different soundbars and found it difficult to choose which one was the best. In the end I decided to get the Bose Solo 5 and man am I glad I did! Bose is the absolute leader in speakers and this soundbar does not disappoint! You must keep in mind that this is not intended to replace or compete with 5.1 surround systems. If you are looking for that loud, encompassing, movie theater experience in a large size living room then you must go with the 5.1 systems. This soundbar is intended for small rooms like a master bedroom or small apartment/condo living room. I mounted mine to the 50" TV in my master bedroom and the sound is perfectly suited for this. The bass is noticeable without being boomy, but still gives that rich Bose sound. The dialogue is very clear and although I do notice an improvement when the dialogue enhancement feature is enabled, I find that the normal setting works just fine. My Logitech Harmony One remote had no problem with adding the Bose Solo 5 and is now integrated perfectly. Highly recommended!
36.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

37.author: Jimbo
37.review: Just bought new 55" LCD 4KHD TV and I did not like the sound from it, as most people do not becuase the speakers are in the back. I looked at all the sound bar options and went to the store to listen and compare. I just wanted better sound. I did not want it to be like I was in the movie theater all the time. Well it seems like all the other options come with a sub woofer that you have to hide somewhere and they are just to much sound for general tv watching. So I decided on this little BOSE and I could not be happier. It actually gives the sound a slight movie style quality but not like at the theater. In addition, I do not notice that the voices are hard to understand as some of the other posts seem to complain about. I think it is perfect for giving you a rich TV sound without the movie surround sound blare. PS If I want the Surround Sound eperience I will turn on my BOSE surround sound system.
37.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

38.author: BBoy
38.review_title: Recommended by Best Buy Staff Member, terrible sou
38.review:
I bought this for my mother in to increase the sound range of a Samsung 40-inch LCD that is probably... 10 years old? Not even? In my experience almost every Samsung has terrible sound when it comes to a TV but hooking this up literally made no difference. Bose used to have a good name, I have a very expensive 2016 Infiniti QX-70S that also has Bose speakers...guess I should have known as I'm not that impressed with them (or Infiniti anymore for that matter - double review!) either.

Endpoint - especially for the ridiculous price do not buy! I have the Vizio SB3821-C6 38-Inch 2.1 Channel Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer connected to a much newer Samsung 55in and literally bug out that someone is in my house because the sound is so "large", realistic, and incredible.
38.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

39.author: DallasEthan
39.review: I bought this to pair with a 50" Samsung TV, I was very pleased with the sound quality, deep bass sounds and clear speech. It's a really nice sound bar if you want something sleek and simple. I have it in a decent sized apartment living room, so I was not wanting something crazy loud with a lot of watts, just good crisp sound. Setup was a breeze, didn't even need to look at the directions to plug things in and get it going. Perfect match with a Samsung in my experience. Synchs easily with the TV and you can use your TV remote to adjust volume. So if you want a simple and discreet sound bar I think this is the winner, and for $250 it's a good deal.
39.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

40.author: ArlGuy
40.review:
I love this soundbar! For my smallish TV room, it's way more than enough volume and sounds fantastic. The dialogue mode is an enormous help if your hearing isn't as good as it once was (that's me), but my wife whose hearing is off-scale good also likes it for most shows and movies. The universal remote makes it super-convenient to use, we've put all the other remotes away. I hate fumbling from one remote to another so, for me, this is a super selling-point. 
I have only two quibbles, both just because I'm fussy. I'd like to be able to set the dialogue mode to be the default so I don't need to keep turning it on. Also, there is no way I've found to get a numeric value for the volume so you can't just jump to a sound level you previously found was good. In our cable setup the volume on live TV is different from that on recorded shows so it would be convenient to be able to return to a given volume level when we switch back and forth.
40.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

41.author: ChiefTazUSN
41.review_title: Great BOSE Sound Bar for Television Sound Quality
41.review: This televison sound bar has great ways of syncing to your television. Cable, Bluetooth and Optical light cable, which is what my Samsung also has for outputs. So darn easy two set up and being a Bose speaker, you have the best of the best for quality sound. One great thing is it's compatible with every brand of television's outputs. Also provided is a universal remote to control every brand of television, DVD and Video players, and even your cable box input. That eliminates you having to keep up with so many devises to control your video players and tv. For me best thing is the fact I'm hard of hearing because of 30 years of extremes sounds I was exposed to in the Navy, and now I can hear my television from any point in my viewing room. Also, you can have it also hooked up to any other items such as my computer's Bluetooth to be able to hear my music and videos stored on the computer. It's a win-win situation. One great benefit is the cost was well within my budget.
41.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

42.author: WalkingtheSummerDog
42.review_title: Excellent sound bar for many uses
42.review: I bought this sound bar because we were tired of the poor sound quality of TV speakers and the difficulty to trying to connect the TV to a sound system. When this sound bar went on sale six months ago, I figured we could not go wrong with a Bose system and decided to make the purchase. We could not be happier with how the sound bar has worked for not only out TV but being able to connect tablets and other wireless devices has added a whole new range to our listening experiences. It is always difficult if not impossible to tell what a system will sound like when in the great open space of a store so I relied on the Bose name for this purchase was not disappointed. The only glitch we had was the optical output on the TV was not functioning. Great product for home use in a moderate size room.
42.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

43.author: JTS39
43.review: Bought a new Sony 65 inch TV. All the flat screen TV's have their speakers on the back, and I'm a little hard of hearing. So I reviewed several sound bars on the web and found the Solo 5. It does not come with a separate sub woofer, but i didn't buy it for the bass. I bought it for sound enhancement, particularly dialogue. In one of the reviews I read, the reviewer had called Bose who told him to plug the optical cable into his cable box instead of the TV for even better sound quality. I did that, and the impact of the sound bar is fabulous. I'm really pleased. And set up is a breeze. Plug in the power source, plug in the optical audio cable, turn it on and you're all set. Took longer to remove the sound bar contents from the box it came in. And the dialogue enhancer button on the remote improves it even further, though I understand you have to separately activate that every time you turn on the sound bar.
43.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

44.author: groundhog
44.review_title: Great sound bar for intended purpose
44.review:
The Bose Solo 5 is intended to provide volume and clarity to a tv's existing speakers. In reality it works best when the tv speakers are turned off.
We are "mature" adults and didn't want the overpowering volume and bass with a more traditional and larger sound bar. We also do not watch a lot of movies. This smaller unit is perfect for our needs. It has a mode that effectively raises the mid-range so it's great for boosting softer vocabulary. Additional bass can be added in a separate mode as well. The small size tucks neatly under the tv without being over powering. We now have 2 Bose Solo 5's, one upstairs and 1 down, both mounted to tv's that are wall mounted. Huge improvement to the sound quality and clarity.
The Solo 5 would also work well in a smaller townhome or apartment.
The price point is a good value as well but not low quality.
44.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

45.author: whoknows
45.review: I waited a few months to write this review because my opinion of the Bose sound bar changed dramatically during that time. At first, I was ready to bring it back thinking that the bass was weak and the overall volume not enough to get a theater experience. My wife liked it though and so I kept it. I'm glad I did. After a couple of weeks (past the time you have to return it), the speaker really opened up and gave us a very natural, satisfying sound. The bass was full and deep but in the background where the bass belongs. The mids and highs were right there and well balanced. Beautiful, full, natural sound. So glad I kept it. Give it a chance, readjust your mind away from the over powering bass of today's sound toward a more natural bass position, and you will find you have a great sound from a small system. Conversation mode is great to hear dialogue over overwhelming bass background while maintaining a good bass sound. Very nice.
45.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

46.author: Bermuda01
46.review_title: Bose sound bar at an affordable price
46.review: Thank you Bose for making your product affordable. I am happy with this "Bose Solo 5-sound bar". I tested your Bluetooth sound system through my favorite jazz music first and its sound amazing as always. I have a few products from you, from the head phone, Bose portable sound link, and now this Bose solo 5 for my flat screen tv. I am quite happy with the quality of Sound from Bose. when it come to Sound, it is only Bose that I trust. I like the design look of this sound bar. It looks modern, slim and sleek and it fit right under my flat screen TV like a custom made piece. And thank you Bose for all the tutorial link of your products. I am a low tech person and found these links very helpful and educational.
46.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

47.author: MSK1
47.review:
It's hard to believe the incredibly fantastic sound that comes from this little tiny magic sound machine. The base has a strong undistorted presence without any annoying pounding, and the high frequency notes are both sharp and crystal clear. Even more amazing is a noticeable measure of stereo separation from all in one box only 22 inches wide.
However, if you're looking for a total emersion bone rattling theatrical surround sound, this is not the system for you. If you want really great TV audio in a conversational living room setting, this magic machine will not disappoint. If you turn up the volume, the Solo 5 has more than enough power to drive your rock parties, if that's your style. The audio quality and compact package make the Solo 5 more than worth the few extra dollars it costs.
47.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

48.author: Schmuck
48.review_title: Get a SoundLink Mini II instead, no bass
48.review: I had been using a Bose SoundLink Mini II for my tv in my small living room and wanted the features this unit offered as well as what I assumed would be even better sound quality. I was extremely disappointed after installing it and comparing the sound quality between the two. The SoundLink Mini II not only comes in a smaller package, is cheaper and portable, but it has better sound quality and more bass. The bass coming out of this speaker is virtually non-existent so I'm not sure how others can say they felt no need for a subwoofer. I adjusted the bass level all the way up while listening to music and couldn't believe I'd spent so much on what I hoped would be the perfect solution for my small living room. I'll be returning this one and going with another option. If you simply want better audio quality than your tv speakers, there are many other options out there that will save you a lot of money.
48.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

49.author: Matt
49.review: I love Bose speakers. I have many of their products. The sound bar doesn’t disappoint as far as sound goes. Where I have issue with it is that it refuses to pair with my new Sony TVs remote. With the soundbar you get a Bose remote that wants you to use it as a universal remote to control everything else. This seems stupid to me. Just allow the Tv remote to control the volume of the Bose bar. Bose didn’t make it easy to do and I still haven’t figured it out. I should say that My Apple TV box had no trouble learning how to control the Bose bar but my new Sony TV just won’t do it and therefore I am stuck using the Bose remote. The Bose remote isn’t bad, but the Sony TV remote is better.
49.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

50.author: BestBuyTR
50.review:
I'm an audiophile and am EXTREMELY picky about my speakers. I was looking for a sound bar for my 55' Samsung for a small living room and boy did this deliver! I had actually purchased the Sonos sound bar and subwoofer and took it back because the dialogue with the Solo 5 was much clearer! Not even close. 

Of course the bass isn't as powerful as the Sonos sub but you'd be surprised what comes out of this tiny titan! Keep in mind that this is not for big rooms. That being said, you won't be disappointed. 

Only critique is that the bracket for this bar (sold separately) isn't solid. If a kid were to hit it from underneath it could potentially come off the bracket and fall down. Other than that it's AWESOME!!! Great job BOSE!!!
50.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

51.author: ForestRock
51.review_title: Really Good, but definitely not higher end Bose
51.review: This is a good little speaker. It works well, has solid bluetooth input from your phone and other devices. While it has a good amount of bass for a sound bar (and a small bar at that), it's not a subwoofer and feels just a bit flat compared to one. It's a nice small footprint, but wish it offered at least the option for a wired or wireless sub. Looks great. I got this over the $500 Bose because of the limitation in cord length because I was mounting this (plus price is hard to beat...way better sound than any other system I heard for under 500). Bose's $1000 systems are incredibly better, but again, they are stuck in the cord era and that just doesn't work with wall mounting tvs these days.
51.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

52.author: Dantes
52.review_title: Nice upgrade from my TV speakers
52.review:
I dont mind that the overall volume is not super loud, I have this set in a small room. 
my only thing is that i dont know the level of volume i have it on, sometimes my wife complains it is too loud and i think is just perfect. Guess it is all subjective.

the speaker is very easy to set up, two cables, one for electrical power, one for connecting to the tv, it is an optical audio, so be sure to check you tv supports it.

the other thing i dont kinda like is the fact that now i have 3 remotes for the tv. AS a universal remote, it kinda works sometimes, however not all DirectTv function are supported, or at least havent found the way to check the recorded shows.
52.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

53.author: thewolf04240
53.review:
I kept going back and forth on the different options available from Bose for my TV. I finally settle on this one, vice the larger version, as I wasn't ready to splurge on the more expensive one till I got a bigger TV.

Setup was easy, has very few connections to get up and running, and the universal remote is more universal than some of the current ones on the market. I connected by Cable box, Apple TV, DVD and TV all to it with issues. The sound quality is GREAT and even at lower levels the sound is clear, crisp and little to no distortion. Obviously there is bass, but not the strength of an external bass speaker. I am very happy with it because it sounds great when watching TV and I can bluetooth my phone to it to play music when I am doing stuff around the house.
53.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

54.author: TJA7
54.review: This little beauty is all you’ll ever need to to actually hear what’s being said without closed captioning or turning up the tv to 100. Just pure and clear sound without spending a million bucks on a home theater system with a sub woofer. More importantly you can actually hear what’s being spoken! Just plug it in and go. It’s not always about having the sound turned up so the neighbors can hear it. This bar just makes pure sound so you can understand what’s being said which makes it appear louder. IMO that’s what matters. Can’t go wrong with this, and after all, it’s Bose. No need to say more. Buy it without going broke and you won’t be disappointed.
54.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

55.author: akarisilver
55.review:
I live in a condo so I am limited to bass free speakers without annoying my neighbors with loud movie explosions. Anyway, the speaker is small enough that sometimes I forget its behind the tv stand. It has good mids and highs which are perfect for my set up. There is some bass that pushes some bump in action movies. 

Set up was simple and the remote is a full functioning universal remote compared to other sound bar mini remotes. For now, I am using my tv remote with the auto on/off function on the sound bar. 

The bluetooth is simple to set up and use it quite often when not watching tv. 

Overall, I am happy with the sound bar, but I gave it 4 stars because I think its over priced. Its normally $250 ( got it for $224), but I think its worth maybe $200.
55.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

56.author: dougd2635
56.review: I live in a two bedroom apartment in a second floor of a house. We have a 65” 4K tv mounted on a full motion mount and the way we’re set up with the walls and where our sofa is the tv needs to be out and turned all the way to the right. So the one speaker on the left side points to the kitchen and we have to have the tv turned up a good bit to hear it over the window ac but it is loud as all h*ll in the kitchen. So I bought this soundbar because it doesn’t have a subwoofer or smaller speakers it’s just the bar. Let me tell you this is the best soundbar I ever bought and I had an lg that sucked but this Solo 5 is perfect in every way for us. So yes it’s a good buy for anyone who has a small area and wants theater quality sound when watching movies well this is it right here.
56.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

57.author: Domgeo
57.review: I am very happy with the Bose-Solo 5 TV soundbar. This soundbar is in one of our bedrooms that has been changed into an exercise room. With a treadmill and an elliptical. I wanted a soundbar that we could hear the tv or music over the noise of our machines. Without turning the volume up so loud we could hear nothing else. This Bose Solo-5 tv soundbar is perfect. The voices and the music are clear. The sound if perfect and the bass tones are excellent. I was concerned about a smaller soundbar without an external subwoofer. ( The subwoofer is within the soundbar). But all is perfect. The bass tones are clear. Easy set up. In fact, I probably set this up to our tv in about 5 minutes. The directions are straight forward and easy to read and follow. I am so happy with this soundbar and the price point for a Bose.
57.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

58.author: wantobelieve
58.review:
I enjoyed obtaining the recent BestBuy Black Friday deal on the Sharp 50 inch Smart TV. However, the sound on this TV wasn't the greatest. Therefore I was looking to augment the TV sound with a separate soundbar, but I didn't want a $50 saddle on at $10 horse. The quality sound, form factor, name recognition, and price drove me to look at the Bose Solo 5 along with a Yamaha sound bar available at Costco. I purchased both, used the Bose on my TV, and gifted the Yamaha to my son (he's very happy with that as well). 

I like the programmable remote included, and am using it to control my entire setup. While I do think that Bose should accommodate HDMI connectivity (Yamaha does), overall I'm very happy with the decision.
58.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

59.author: BestBuyer220
59.review: I bought this as a gift for my mother. She was so excited when she saw the “Bose” name. Her bedroom TV has weak sound and even on MAX, she cannot hear the dialog sometimes. When I used the Bluetooth connection to play music from my phone, the sound was pretty good. Once I connected it to the TV with the included optical cable, the sound was terrible. It was no better than the TV speaker output, completely defeating the purpose of buying it. I couldn’t believe the volume didn’t go higher. My mom was so excited when she opened her gift, it really upset me that the gift was ultimately useless. She told me if the volume didn’t go higher, get my money back. That’s what I did. Disappointed!
59.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

60.author: Stuart
60.review: I bought this sound bar at my local Best Buy yesterday. Why? We like the British shows on TV, but they are increasingly hard to understand. This is our sixth Bose purchase, and our first unsatisfactory one. The optical guide from our Sharp TV to the sound bar failed - we blame Sharp. The coax connection from Sharp to the sound bar failed - we blame the poor Bose connection. We finally succeeded by bringing audio from the cable box to the sound bar. The remote was successfully capable of programming our Sharp TV, the sound bar, and the Verizon cable box. It failed on the LG Blue Disc player. Worst of all, the Solo 5 cannot be registered on the Bose website. Sad. Is it better than our Sharp speakers? I want to say yes, but I just can't justify it.
60.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

61.author: joshhunt
61.review:
I kept the box in the garage in case I wanted to return it. I will be keeping it. It is a big improvement over the TV speakers. I really like the voice isolation. I used to watch shows with the closed caption on. It has just enough bass and you can hear the dialogue.

That said, I have two complaints. 
1) it is just as loud as I would have expected. It is loud enough--barely. I have it on max volume all the time. That is just enough, but just enough. I wish it was this loud at about half volume. 

2) I wish there were some visible indication of how loud it is. When you turn the volume up on your TV, it shows you that you are at volume level xx. With the Bose solo, you don't know if you are at 5 or 8 or maxed out.
61.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

62.author: TarHeel
62.review: I have a piece of furniture where the space for the sound bar is not as wide as many of the sound bars are, so I got the Bose which is only about 24 inches wide. It sounds very good and I am happy with it. It's relatively inexpensive and doesn't have a subwoofer, so it's not something that is going to blow you away, but it's exactly what I needed for general TV watching. One nice feature is that it comes on automatically when the TV gets turned on. I have DirecTV and this means I don't have to use a separate remote for it. The DirecTV remote controls the sound and it automatically turns on and off with the TV.
62.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

63.author: TedSJ
63.review: This was my first Soundbar and I am really pleased. I looked at other systems, but I have the noise-cancelling BOSE headphones and use those every night. So I stuck with Bose. I live in a condo so I did not need a subwoofer. That said, this was plenty of base for my living room, and it is vastly better than the speakers in my new Samsung 50" Ultra HDtv. The Bluetooth function works perfectly, and the base is honestly even better than my headphones. In fact any more base and I would have unhappy neighbors! Not sure I like the remote yet, but it is only the first day so I am still playing around with it. It does not mimic surround sound, as others have written, but if you have a relatively small living space this will do you right! Great, sleek soundbar.
63.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

64.author: fmendo2004
64.review: At first, I hesitated buying this product after reading some of the reviews. However, when it comes to sound, I've been buying Bose products for years and never been disappointed. Therefore, I took a chance and I'm so happy I bought this speaker to upgrade the sound on my Vizio TV. Previously, I was having a hard time hearing people talk through the TV's speakers when watching a show or movie. With the Bose soundbar, everything is a lot clear and I'm able to hear everything. I will highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking to upgrade the TV speakers and looking for a soundbar which doesn't take too much space. Bose is the best in sound technology. Awesome sound from little speakers. I love this product.
64.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

65.author: Kclams
65.review: i wanted something to replace the integral speakers of the tv. For me this is the ideal unit. While not boasting obnoxious volume, it is just right for my needs. I am using it in a 26x12 room. It provides excellent frequency response and sound leveL with no distortion what so ever. I was not looking for extreme volume or surround sound, so this unit is perfect. My tv only had digetal audio out, so this unit works well. It has other audio connections as well. I was able to program My xfinity cable controller to power up and control this unit as well. It was real easy once I got the right number for programming from the internet. The controller that came with it is really nice also, but I don't need it.
65.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

66.author: Robv
66.review_title: Basic - no subwoofer & no visible volume #s
66.review:
I was green / new to the sound bar thing. 
The young salesman discussed with me the dolby sydtem within the sound bar which decompesses the sound & therefore produces better sound. I bought this one at a different time from the tv because I had done some internet research and I put this together with old guy O.G. army days music listening experience.
Now when i took it home and hooked it up to the tv, i notice it did not have numerical #s on it so i could see for instance I had it on say 12 and thats where it should stay so its at a courtious listening level. So, I took it back to best try and asked the brothers if they had one that had visible volume control #s. They showed me a couple of sound bars in that price range that even had subwoofer (a bonus).
66.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

67.author: Stereo1
67.review: I wanted a small sound bar with great acoustics to be paired with my 40" Samsung UHD TV. After reading many reviews I decided to purchase the Bose Solo 5. The sound is fantastic! I like the "voice enhancement" feature which can be enabled/disabled with one button on the remote. The unit is well made and even comes with an optical cable to connect it to the TV. (RCA cables are also included for older TVs.) The remote is of the highest quality and can be programmed to run my Samsung TV and blue ray player. I don't like booming bass when watching TV, so this was the perfect sound bar. The overall sound and dialog is wonderful. If you are into earth shaking bass then you will need to purchase a different model that supports a sub-woofer.
67.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

68.author: Rambler
68.review: This is my first purchase of a Bose product. I have been impressed with the quality of this product. It was easy and simple to setup and did not take very long to get it hooked up. It has definitely improved the quality of sound with my TV. The sound bar has a light that lets you see when you are increasing the volume or when you have muted the sound. One small negative is the remote doesn't give a visual, such as a bar or number, when increasing or decreasing volume. The Bose remote will control functions on the TV and as a result I use the Bose remote about 95% of the time I am watching TV. I really like the size of the sound bar as it is relatively compact and doesn't take up as much space as many other sound bars I considered.
68.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

69.author: Rosie
69.review: I live in an apartment so I didn't need a separate subwoofer. This sound bar is perfect for my space. Excellent bass for movies without worrying about the neighbors feeling it in the walls. There is also a dialogue only mode for when you're watching the news and things of that nature. The remote is universal so you can program it to turn everything on and off at the same time. Unfortunately it gets out of sync sometimes. I don't like that it doesn't have a volume indicator. 1-10 type thing. Just a little light that flashes. It's a little pricey but bose usually is. It definitely has the bose sound.
69.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

70.author: shopperx
70.review_title: Okay, but not quite up to BOSE par.
70.review: I've had several Bose speakers in the past and got superior sound from all of them. But this speaker doesn't have as rich a sound as others. The unit is taller than most, too, which a a bit problematic as it cuts into my TV screen (which is up on a mantle). If it were lower, this wouldn't happen. I bought a Sony bar on sale before this and returned it because it was too long so interfered with the TV's remote signal on my Roku TV (which is really a Roku design flaw) but the sound on the Sony was not as good as this Bose, so I'm keeping the Bose . I would recommend to a friend, but with reservations.
70.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

71.author: DanfromPa
71.review:
Ok. So I had a Vizio sound bar for about 5 years. Just the other day it decided to drop out. So I went to Best Buy to see what they had. 
First the display had been acting up and all the sound bars on display weren't working. So was sure what I was going to do. 
After I see only ONE sound bar was working within the budget. The Bose solo 5. 
Pros
It's a Bose
It wasn't insanely priced
It's loud 
It's got some good bass
Comes with optical cord
Bluetooth 
Cons
No exterior buttons 
Have to use the remote to turn volume up down and on/off so now I have yet another remote laying around. 
Every other sound bar( that I couldn't preview sound on) had external buttons. What make Bose so special they don't include them.
71.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

72.author: Matt
72.review:
This is a solid addition to a small room TV set up. I bought this to go along with my wall mounted 55 inch LED in my office. This speaker puts out plenty of sound for my office. Great Bluetooth feature. 

Cons:
Remote feels cumbersome
Little bass response

Pros
Sleek
Decent mids and highs
Easily mounted with wall mount (purchase necessary)
Simple to hook up to tv (one chord)

Can't give it 4 stars because of the lack of bass. But I am buying another for my master bedroom at home. So clearly I like the product.
72.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

73.author: btg1
73.review:
I purchased this unit for a small den, and it proved to be the right choice for the space. Bose sound quality comes through in this small unit, which sits on a desk right under the tv. 
No woofer\no problem in this set up. Plenty of sound, with a switch to target mid range\speech when desired. The included all in one remote can control 6 devices, incl Cable box, TV, BD\DVD, games, Aux, and Bluetooth. No 5th star as it would have been nice to have an on\off & volume controls on the box itself. 
If you've got a smaller space, and want quality sound w\o chest thumping bass, this unit more than fits the bill.
73.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

74.author: TREx
74.review: This is a great product. It is very easy to set up. The sound quality is so much better than my Vizio TV alone. For this price it can't be beat. That said, it is a little lacking in bass department and the remote control does get out of sync with the TV & Satellite box, frequently. It does become annoying but a quick re-sync and it is good to go again. I am glad I got this product to use until I have the money to get the Bose Soundtouch 300 & Acoustimass 300 Wireless Bass Module. I may even tie in some of the Bose 300 surround sound modules as well. This speaker is a great introduction to Bose products.
74.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

75.author: DoFer
75.review_title: A little disappointed in this device!
75.review:
