I want to qualify this review by admitting to being somewhat hearing impaired.
This unit was bought to replace a “other” brand sound bar that I did not feel was that good. After getting the Solo 5 set up (relatively easy ) and making various adjustments to fit my hearing, and using the ”voice mode“ I have come to the conclusion that the this unit Is only marginally better, for me in particular. My wife on the other hand, thinks that it is much better. One caviat is that we do not have the volume very high. My wife has very good hearing. If playing music at a higher column the sound quality does seem to improve.
75.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

76.author: Spocknation39056
76.review:
So I live on the 3rd floor of my apartment complex. I want the big booming home theatre sound with a subwoofer and all the goods. But I can’t. 


The Bose Solo 5 is an excellent choice for someone looking for nice sound in a small space without thumping the walls and floor around you. It sounds clear, and the lows sound good too. Music sounds excellent. Hip-Hop, R&B, Reggae, Rock and Jazz are what I listen to and I am very satisfied with how it sounds. TV and video games are good too.
76.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

77.author: DPDP
77.review: As stated in the title, the sound is very rich and deep compared to my tv’s speakers. We have a smaller living room and this is probably a little much for the space but it sounds great for just about all programming. The big plus is that it has Bluetooth and with the press of a button you can have music playing. Very easy to set up and get going, and compact so it’s barely noticeable and very unassuming to guests. When it’s cranked up my friends usually have a stunned look on their faces and think it’s coming from the tv. Overall it’s worth the money to upgrade tv speakers and add some depth and clarity to the tv experience.
77.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

78.author: BillArden
78.review:
This soundbar seems to me to be lacking highs. I'd prefer more highs.
Also, the music/speech button makes some difference, but very little. It would be better, I think, if the difference was greater.
The sound surely doesn't make anyone say, "Wow, I love that Bose sound!" like they do when they hear a 600$+ Bose system. 
I DO like the fact that TV, cable, and sound are all controlled (most functions) from a single remote which is relatively easy to set up. I've never been able (or willing!) to make that happen with other remotes.

SUMMARY: I DO like it, but the sound is not spectacular IMHO.

I recommend it, with the reservations noted above.
78.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

79.author: Tech4me2night
79.review_title: Good things do come in small packages
79.review: Setup was fast and easy - less then 5 minutes. I have read reviews where users have said that the sound does not fill the room or that the sound lack bass when in use. I could not disagree more. I have the unit in a relatively large room and the sound is perfect. Bass can be added using the Bose remote, so that was not an issue.The one thing that I will state is that the Bose universal remote could not control my Xfinity X1 cable box so I had to train my Xfinity X1 remote to control the sound bar. Not a deal breaker by any stretch, but it would have been nice to have one less remote.But, if you're looking for a high quality Bose sound bar at a decent price, then this unit will fit the bill.
79.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

80.author: jose
80.review_title: good but not as good as separate speakers
80.review: I was looking for a simple way to provide better sound for my flat screen TV. I cannot understand a lot of dialog on the built-in speakers on the TV. I have an receiver/amplifier with center, side, and base speakers but I have to turn on all gadgets and use different remotes for the amplifier. This is where the Bose Solo 5 is better. It connects directly to the TV and volume is controlled by the TV remote. Another thing I like is the "dialog" setting which enhances the voice so I can hear better. I would give it 5 stars but sound is not as good as a big Hi-Fi. It is probably better than cheaper sound bars and cheaper soundbars do not have the "dialog" setting.
80.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

81.author: Tango
81.review: There’s already a ton of reviews but I wil, say this, set up was super easy, the sound is really nice and clear. Love the remote that came with it. It rivals the expensive Logitech universal remotes. Bass is okay but this is expected when it’s just a bar and does not have an external sub woofer. I bought this to get rid of my traditional Sony sound bar and sub, in order to clean up my set up and reduce the wires. This nose unit is relatively small and living in a apartment or condo, it’s nice to have great sound without worrying about blowing our your neighbors with a huge subwoofer.
81.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

82.author: AddisonGeek
82.review: I normally wouldn't purchase an expensive item such as this, so having gift cards and Christmas money helped with my decision. I was very pleased to note that my old Insignia TV had an optical output, and that the Bose included the cable for the connection. I have watched talk shows, movies, and listened to DVD's through my Blu-Ray player. What's nice is that the sound bar "remembers" the bass setting, so pressing the dialogue button on the remote for talk shows is great. My wife likes it better than having our old Bose Wave sitting on the floor in front of the TV stand. I was able to sell that, so that recouped some of the outlay for the Bose Sound Bar.
82.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

83.author: TXFootballFamily
83.review: We have been looking for a sound bar system for our main TV and had been wrestling with the issues of where to put the subwoofer, and did we want to make holes in the wall to run wires & then wall mount the speakers. Then we found this unit. Tested it out in the store with all kinds of media - sports, music, movies, etc. Sound was great in the store. Bought it that night, took it home & set it up. Put the original Star Wars (Episode IV) into the DVD player & turned it up so we could get a feel for what we should expect. Bottom line - better than home, not quite the big screen, but in a 22-foot room, it's way better than expected. Fantastic for watching sports too!
83.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

84.author: a777
84.review_title: Excellent small form factor sound bar
84.review: This sound bar is excellent. It is small and compact but packs a powerful punch of sound. It has fairly balanced sound as well with full base but not heavy and great mids. It is easy to hookup and comes with the optical cable in the box. The remote is huge for such a small device and really unnecessarily. My one grip would be that the soundbar doesnt support ARC HDMI so everytime I turn on the TV I also have to use the huge remote that comes with this soundbar to just power it on. For an affordable small form factor soundbar, this bose is excellent.
84.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

85.author: Pred
85.review: I purchased this sound bar in November of 2016 and the first 3 months it worked great. However in march I began to experience crackling in the sound as the volume was turned up. These things happen sometimes, so I sent it into Bose to have it serviced. In their defense they handled that great however when I received it back the problem was not fixed. I had to send it back to then AGAIN. Now I usually put Bose as one of the more quality and trustworthy sound companies so this purchase was a bit of a let down. Since the second repair it has been working well again. For Bose sake, I hope my experience was a fluke
85.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

86.author: Bulldog
86.review: I specifically bought this because of the comments on how it made speech clearer. Was looking forward to using the dialogue button to help me understand what people were saying. In all fairness to the product I will state that I wear hearing aids in both ears. Sometimes speech, usually from a movie or TV drama is so mumbled that I cannot understand what is being said. Installation was a snap but after it was installed I noticed absolutely no difference between the sound from the TV speakers or from the sound bar..Dialogue button on or off made no difference either A total waste of money at least for my ears. I returned the product.
86.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

87.author: NotImpressed
87.review_title: Not the sound I expected from Bose.
87.review: I contemplated buying after testing the demo months before I purchased. I was impressed with the demo in the store and went between it and the Vizio priced much cheaper. I was disappointed when I got it home because I didn't feel like the sound quality was near what I had experienced with the demo. If I had it to do over, I would have spent less money and purchased the Vizio which has noticeable bass. This does not. Even after turning up the bass, I noticed no difference. I wanted a rich sound experience, not just a speaker. I paid for rich sound and simply got sound. The $99 Vizio has richer sound but the price is more like a simple speaker.
87.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

88.author: AGallica
88.review: For such a long time, I wasn't able to hear a TV conversation, unless I cranked the sound to the max. Bose came up with Sollo 5, which is a little more affordable than the 10 and the 15. I just purchased it, and, I now can enjoy listening and watching this TV of mine. The set-up is 1-2-3, within seconds. Solo 5 is a great alternative to an expensive surround sound and this one works perfectly for me. I always thought that Bose was great, and, it is proven again.
88.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

89.author: Christine
89.review: Purchased this just so that we would have better sound quality. Not something you would want to purchase if your looking for a theater experience. But if your just looking for better quality because your speakers on your tv point down! This is perfect. The remote was a little tricky since all of my products are the same brand. Also I couldn't get it to sync with my PlayStation. Another downfall is that if your going to put it directly in front of your tv, that's where the sensor for most tvs are to control them. We have been getting an arm workout since we do not have our tv mounted and we do not have a shelf that fits the speaker on our stand.
89.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

90.author: Chris
90.review_title: Big sound in a small package.
90.review: The Bose solo 5 was purchased to give me better sound on a smaller tv that wasn’t equipped with good speakers to begin with. Setup was pretty easy for the sound bar. You can adjust bass and treble to your liking and the “dialogue” mode was great for news programs. The universal remote is nice but a little tricky to set up at first. The Bluetooth capability is we’re it shines, the sound quality of the music is great. Overall it’s a nice setup for what I was trying to do.
90.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

91.author: bignix
91.review: This is not the speaker you want if you want to blow your walls off and rattle the floors for movies and get surround sound feeling, but it is plenty loud enough to enjoy and get the feeling that you are in fact watching a movie. The main reason i did get this Bose was for the clarity of the dialogue.It has a special dialogue button which reduces background noise and emphasizes the voices so you can actually hear what people are saying. 1 word to the wise, make sure you hook it up from the cable box to the speaker, not the tv to the speaker. For some reason it makes an incredible difference, especially the loudness and deepness of the sound.
91.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

92.author: ipodlin
92.review_title: Brings the cinema to your living room
92.review: Bose does it again with another amazing audio device. The sound is typical to all of bose audio products from headphones to speakers with the ability to push maximum volume with no distortion. The bass is incredible and the acoustics are crisp. I will never want to watch TV or a movie using the TV speakers again. The drawback is the massive lotion bottle size remote that controls the unit and the bricked power cord. Avoid wasting your money on imitation soundbars and just buy yourself a bose. It is a solid investment.
92.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

93.author: Pancho
93.review:
I have been dreaming to have a bose speaker ever since because of the good review in terms of sound quality. When a friend needed a speaker for his karaoke set up I have to let go and have to give him my preloved sound bar and buy a new sound bar for my self. Iweny to best buy and they 
showed me differend brands 
but I ended up buying BOSE solo 5. I experienced great quality of sound.
93.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

94.author: PapawJeff
94.review:
We love our big screen HD Smart TV mounted on the wall but have never been happy with all the sound blasting out of the back of the TV.
It would bounce off the wall and deafen anyone in the kitchen, but where my wife would sit in the living room she couldn't hear the voices unless it was sky high, and it would blast me out of the room.
If your looking for a theater surround sound, look further.
But if your looking for a very high quality compact soundbar with excellent sound at a very reasonable price I highly recommend the Bose Solo 5.
94.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

95.author: Sergio
95.review: Our surround sound theater in a box system died after years of great service. Rather than go the same route and have additional speakers that are not needed, we simplified and when with a sound bar instead. Should have done this a long time ago. We have a Roku and Blu-Ray player connected to the TV and an optical digital audio cable from the TV to the sound bar. Done. Sound quality is excellent. Excellent mid-range and highs and the bass is quite good considering there is not sub-woofer. We are using this in our living room but it would also be great in a bedroom. Very happy with the purchase.
95.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

96.author: Alisa
96.review_title: Fantastic sound bar for hard of hearing
96.review: We bought a 55 inch 4K Samsung TV. Picture was amazing but we had a terrible time understanding conversations during shows. I had heard this was a common problem with the larger, thinner TVs. After reading many customer reviews, I decided to try out this Bose sound bar. It has a feature which reduces background noise/bass and makes the conversations much clearer. The first time listening was amazing. No longer do we have to increase the volume to understand what is being said. Give this produce the highest of ratings. Great price and product!
96.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

97.author: Matador99
97.review: After about a month with this product, must say this sound bar does what it needs. Smooth sound, and pretty good mini surround sound. Use it for gaming sound, and movies and makes a difference in sound quality, sound is so narrow and smoth makes watching movies and gaming much more enjoyable. As far as for music, if you like enjoying music and the nice song compositions, beats, and nice voice it does a cute job. Only downer is that it doesn't have supper hard core base, it has base don't get me wrong bust not as much to suppor some hard core base music. Aside from that product is supper good for the price.
97.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

98.author: Dingus
98.review:
Purchased to replace a bulky sound system after mounting the TV over the fireplace. The sound is great, it really fills the room with sound. Everything is very clear and full. The universal remote connected to all of my devices with full functionality. 
The power brick is about the size of a deck of cards and is a little hard to hide, but it comes with a Velcro strap so it can be hung from the TV mount if you have it mounted under the TV. The bass is not as heavy as I would prefer, but still sounds great. No distortion at high volumes.
98.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

99.author: Bestwep
99.review:
Easy to set up with good sound. High range is fine but you cant get bass and voice both at max. The system reduces base and extraneous noises in order to clarify the voices.
Seems to work but stil needs to be cranked up high. This was a gift for my hard of hearing Mom since TV speaker really needed to be set way too high.
I decided to get the Bose Soundbar300 which has way better sound and is expandable in the future. Much better choice.
I recommend this only within limitations but Bose is always a good choice. Ps prices are a little high so beware if on a limited budget.
99.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

100.author: vgol
100.review: Firstly, let me get my audience right. If you are looking for a wall mountable sleek audio soundbar that delivers loud audio as well as crisp dialogue and clean music, and if you are looking for something that is not uber expensive. This product is for you. I was taken aback by the clarity it produces. I am an ex-owner of Solo 15 Series I, to be honest, I was a little disappointed with Solo 15 but couldnt do anything about it because it was company won raffle and dint wanted to discard it away. But Solo 5 beats Solo 15 in my opinion. I highly recommend this product.
100.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

101.author: RUKiddingMe
101.review: Product comes with universal remote which is nice but quite frankly not totally thrilled about having yet another remote. Have a couple of cables (power cord, optical cable) that are now hanging down from TV after I went through all the trouble to put other wires behind wall but suppose there isn't any other option short of making new holes in the wall. Sound quality is good, but thought that the it wasn't quite as good as when we used to have Bose Lifestyle speakers connected. I am by no means a audiophile so you don't take my word for it, try it for yourself the Best Buy store should have one connected to a TV for you to try.
101.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

102.author: MRM92
102.review: I bought this just to use in the bedroom, so I was not looking for anything expensive or flashy. The sound quality is what is expected from BOSE without a bass. The only thing I wish it had, was more bass. However, I do not need a bass to keep bumping. It enhances my tv's sound and was easy to set up. I just with that using the BOSE controller as a universal remote would be easier to use with TiVo. It works, however with Tivo's distinct features and separate menus, I have to reach for the actual remote. Not a deal breaker at all.
102.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

103.author: AlexJW
103.review: Purchased this speaker for an add-on for a small kitchen TV to improve the sound clarity for a hear impaired individual. The sound is pretty good, definitely better than the TV speakers but it could put out a bit more sound overall. I knew it did not come with HDMI connectivity when I purchased it but still think this would have been an easier connection option for most peoples setup. Lastly, the remote sensor could better - seems like we have to point the remote right at the sensor for it to work. None of these are huge set backs; the sound is good and the size it small so overall it meets our needs.
103.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

104.author: scottythatsme
104.review: With this sound bar being made by Bose - you can count on the sound quality being good. I can't argue with that. My main use of it is to use the digital out sound from a television to it. My issues with the sound bar are that it's hard to switch inputs (Bluetooth, aux, etc). I've had trouble with it not turning on as expected. It's getting more and more erratic in its functions. I really wish there was an app to manage functions. I consider myself pretty tech savvy, but using the Bose Solo 5 sound bar causes me more frustration than anything else.
104.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

105.author: Jeff
105.review:
Read other reviews - and the only negatives were from people wanting it to be something it's not - SurroundSound. 
This is a Quality set of Speakers - that are needed on every flat screen , that's in a wall unit - the tv speakers are pointing backwards and the wall unit shrouds the sound. This literally took 5 seconds to hook up . Turned the tv speakers off and now only use these. Also have my cable tv music channels playing thru this and it creates a great background for a party/ social gathering - or even just sitting back and unwinding . Bass isn't bad either.
Liked it so much we bought a second unit
105.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

106.author: TDcolo
106.review: I was in search of a new sound bar and one that would give me clear dialogue. We don't watch a lot of movies or care so much about booming sound effects - we just want to hear and understand what people are saying. We have other Bose products and love them. This was an affordable option - though we were bummed to see it went on sale for $25 less soon after we bought it and the store wouldn't credit us because it was more than 14 days before we said anything. Like by a few days. And the bar was still on sale :( But the bar itself is great and we enjoy it.
106.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

107.author: MandaLea
107.review: I bought this for my parents and they love it. They do not need booming bass or tons of inputs/outputs; they just needed the vocal clarity that most new tvs don't offer. This was extremely easy for them to set up and they're enjoying it immensely. I'm considering buying one for my upstairs bedroom because I really don't need a sub rumbling the ceiling downstairs. I'd recommend this Bose soundbar to anyone looking to boost their tvs volume and clarity but doesn't need or want the extra bass that comes with a subwoofer or the extra time, effort, and cost, of setting up a full sound system.
107.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

108.author: PANonTechie
108.review: I will start by saying I am no expert on TVs or sound bars. We bought a flat screen TV and the sound was terrible and everyone said we needed a sound bar. Due to the location of the TV, we could not fit one of the long ones - this was the only short one I could find and I trusted Bose. Sound is good - much improved. It looks nice. I don't know if I would say the sound is great...but I am happy and keeping it. Price is reasonable. Bought the stand for it to sit on which works nicely - seems to be floating on the wall. Still working on figuring out the remote which should work all of our devices.
108.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

109.author: Tegan
109.review: I purchased this product after reading some of the other reviews. They are correct in that it is not going to give you surround sound but for me it really does the job because TV speakers are not of very good quality and I don't hear as well as I used to. It enables me to listen to the TV without having to turn the volume up as loud as it will go. I also like the fact that it is only one piece and I don't have to have wires all over the place. The best thing of all to me is that it was really easy to set up and I only need one remote to work the TV and the sound system. I highly recommend it.
109.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

110.author: Herbie
110.review: I bought this for my uncle. He mainly watches baseball games and is not a big sound person. I spent some time with him told him the sound would be better on his TV with a sound bar, so we went out and bought this one. When he listened to his first game with it, he was hearing things he had never heard before. The sounds were richer and he could turn it up louder because of the better bass it produces. Great purchase.
110.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

111.author: SHerold
111.review_title: Perfect for a Small Enclosed Location
111.review:
I bought this for use with a 40" TV in my home office. It's used to listen to music during the work week, deliver computer audio for conference calls, and sneak in some PlayStation 4. The available settings for music vs. voice profiles make this perfect soundbar for a small enclosed space.

My TV is mounted in a corner, so typical wall mounts that are available for sound bars would not work. I instead picked up some metal brackets from the local hardware store, and with some M8 (I believe) screws, was able to build a perfect soundbar mount that mounts directly to the back of the TV.
111.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

112.author: JoviR
112.review: I purchased this Bose sound bar because the price point was great. Especially for it being a Bose product. It's small enough to fit on my entertainment system and carries good sound and base. My sony tv's sound quality is very poor which made me want to buy a sound bar to improve it's performance. I'm one happy customer, and would recommend this for someone looking to buy a sound bar that doesn't want to pay an arm and a leg for a full on sound system. This little thing does the job wonderfully. :)
112.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

113.author: tech55
113.review: The soundbar sounds really good compared to my TV. Pretty good price for a Bose quality bar. There is a millisecond delay in the audio. You can tell when you have the TV and soundbar volume up simultaneously. There were two different boxes at best buy for this same soundbar. One had solid blue on the edge with the word Bose in white on it. The other was just plain white on all sides. I picked the plain white box and it came with the optical cord. Not sure if the other box contained the optical cord. It's six feet long.
113.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

114.author: MLFan
114.review: Great sound, can really hear things that you didn't hear before. Bluetooth works great and was easy to connect to other devices. Bass is a little lacking but overall sound is great. Was able to set my directv remote to control the volume and when the soundbar senses audio from the TV through the optical cable it turns the sound bar on. It also turns itself off after a hour of no audio. Only have to use the Bose remote if I need to switch inputs, but for normal everyday use I don't use it. Enjoy!
114.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

115.author: BHome
115.review: I bought this to replace a very old surround sound system with 5 speakers and a sub woofer. I wanted to reduce to one speaker, so I purchased this sound bar. I read some reviews on line, and I know Bose's reputation, and purchased this bar. I am very pleased with the sound; it has all the fullness I had with the larger system, in a single, very sleek speaker. Just remember, if you want to mount it, you need to purchase the wall mounting system separately, and Best Buy does not carry it. On the plus side, the optical cable was provided with the speaker.
115.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

116.author: Unhappy
116.review: I've been very pleased with previous Bose products but I'm sorry to say I'm disappointed with the Solo 5 sound bar. Audio quality is fine but there is too much base response and as a result there is a very audible "thump" in the audio. So far I haven't been able to reduce/modify the base response of the unit to reduce this annoying sound. Instructions state that the Solo 5 remote can be programmed to operate other devices; so far I've been unsuccessful in programming the remote to accommodate this feature. Sorry Bose this product doesn't meet expectations!!
116.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

117.author: Acustomer1
117.review_title: Surround sound quality in a tiny package!
117.review: Was looking for a single sound bar that could provide theatrical style sound without an entire surround sound speaker set up. This was my first Bose purchase so I was a little skeptical about the sound quality since it was so small and pretty expensive for what it was. After 2 months of everyday use I couldn't be happier! I will always buy Bose now the sound this tiny little sound bar puts out is incredible!. Sound quality is on par with most sound are and subwoofer systems. This sound bar puts out amazing theatrical sound in a space saving great looking package. A definite buy.
117.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

118.author: Russ
118.review:
The Bose Solo 5 TV soundbar sounds much better than any internal TV speakers, and has an impressive, rich, full, smooth sound signature for such a small soundbar. IMO, it's best suited for smaller spaces such as a bedroom, or office, but could work well in a living space depending on the size of the space and your expectations (it's not going to give you a home theater like experience). 
Only 4 stars, because it lacks HDMI inputs/pass-through, and it's premium price tag.
118.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

119.author: Tyhome
119.review: I have the solo 15 in the living room and I purchased this solo 5 for my bedroom cause new TV these days might as well not have speakers. The TV I purchased was load enough thank god cause in comparison the solo 5 is nothing compared to the solo 15. For the same amount of money the solo 5 is a waste of money. If you have had better it's hard to settle for less. It not horrible, I would always buy Bose over any other speaker brand but Bose has to give the same quality in there products to keep customers like me coming back.
119.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

120.author: FlyinBlind72
120.review: Perhaps I simply expect more of the Bose line of products. While the sound is good and I like the dialogue mode, I'm having a lot of difficulty getting the remote programmed and for all components to come on together. The soundbar periodically won't sync with the other components and sometimes it will turn off for no apparent reason. Doesn't happen much but once in the middle of a movie is too much for me. 95% of the time it performs to my expectations. If I was going to do it again, I'd buy the more expensive Bose or a 3-channel Samsung unit.
120.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

121.author: GolfingDude
121.review: I just moved and wanted to get a better solution than just my computer speakers and PC plugged into my tv. This sound bar simplifies things exponentially. I have only one connection from the TV to the sound bar and any HDMI signal that I feed into my TV is automatically routed to the sound bar. It also has a built in RF connection, but I don't have a laptop so that feature I won't be using. But it is a definite nice to have if someone wants to link up their phone and share some audio. All in all, I am very happy with it. It is loud, clear and looks great.
121.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

122.author: basil016
122.review_title: Great sound bar for a smaller room
122.review: Very good soundbar for the price. Music also sounds great with the bluetooth connection. The dialogue mode is actually way more useful than I originally thought. My one and only gripe is that you can only have one connection in at a time. I used the optical cable to connect to my tv and then plugged in my chromecast audio into the aux input but you CANNOT switch inputs. you would have to disconnect the optical cable to get the aux to work. Other than this one gripe it is a very solid sound bar.
122.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

123.author: audiodad
123.review: for my listening, this fits the bill. fills the room. but not the house. at higher volumes gets "light". you can tell it is not a receiver. definitely better than a tv speaker though. dont like that it senses inputs and you cant just select inputs. eg if i have analog jack connected and digital optical, it wont allow me to choose one or ther other and have both connected at same time with audio in both.
123.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

124.author: Hendersong
124.review: This sound bar is all my wife and I needed to enhance our new TV purchase. There is no separate sub-woofer with this unit but we don't miss it and really don't need it. Were not using the sound bar to listen to music or TV at a loud volume, we just needed to increase the volume of our TV so we could comfortably hear it. When the furnace kicked on we used to have to adjust the volume all of the time on the TV but with the sound bar we just adjust it once when we turn on the TV and never adjust it again. This is a quality product at a fair price.
124.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

125.author: ThePearl
125.review: I wasn't really looking for a sound bar when I happened to pass this one in the store. I stopped and listened to the demo and was immediately blown away with the big sound. The price was also impressively low, especially since it is a Bose! I couldn't resist buying one and taking it home to try it out on a TV that has low sound quality. It immediately made the sound 1,000 times better, and that is not an exaggeration! I couldn't ask for better sound, and it takes up so little space, too!
125.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

126.author: Hawaiiman
126.review: I love Bose products. That being said I am pretty disappointed in this product. Maybe I am missing something but I constantly am having connection issues with this sound bar and my New Samsung 4K tv. I typically have to turn off my tv, then the sound bar like 4 times before I can get them to pair. Sometimes I must remove the Bluetooth device first then re pair it. I have used numerous Bluetooth products in the past. The sound quality is okay. I am use to a real nice Triad Surround sound system. I am in home where I can't install my Triad system.
126.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

127.author: EOSCSIX
127.review: I have a large room where the TV is located and I had a VISIO sound bar with that TV. I was never happy with the VISIO. There are some tones that I have trouble hearing and I was having trouble with dialog in some shows. I purchased this Solo 5 soundbar and I was disappointed with the sound quality, not much better than the VISIO. I returned the Solo 5 and purchased the Bose Soundtouch soundbar. Big difference! I especially like the dialog mode. In my opinion, don't waste you money on the Solo 5.
127.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

128.author: Ronnieboy
128.review_title: An earsaver for the hard of hearing!
128.review: I have a 75 inch TV. I think it came with one inch speakers. I would turn them up loud but still the sound was muffled, especially the dialogue. I finally decided to spend the $250 for the Bose sound bar and it was the best money I ever spent, as far as hearing TV is concerned. It even has a dialogue button that clears up the speech even further. It's a shame that what I spent on the TV didn't include better speakers, but the Bose was the solution. Whether you're hard of hearing or not, you'll enjoy a more rich and clear sound.
128.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

129.author: whargoul76
129.review: I ended up going through two other soundbars befor I bought this one. The first was just horrible sound, the second one the subwoofer worked and the bar didn't . Both I bought because they were on sale and thought OK they've been around awhile how bad could they be. Luckily Best Buy has great customer service and satisfaction standards. They took them back and were determined to make me happy. Item was flawless out of the box and is what I expected from Bose. I paid a little more but am happy with what I paid for. Thanks again Best buy!
129.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

130.author: Kamuzic
130.review: This is a wonderful speaker for TV in a small room. Nice rich bass and clear treble. In the bedroom we didn't want a sub-woofer to clutter things up. This certainly clarifies the sound and fills the room to enhance movie watching experience. It has a special setting to sharpen voices being broadcast making it more enjoyable to hear. Bose is always a crisp wonderful sound. My wife wants one for our family room, but I think it's too small for that, after all a family room needs our 7.1 theater surround system that will shake you to your core if you need it to. :)
130.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

131.author: Nick
131.review_title: Great sound bar for the size!
131.review:
My Bose soundbar is terrific! It fills up my big family room, which is great when you consider how small it is, and the fact that it has a built in sub woofer. It is very easy to connect my blue tooth devices to. I would have given it an 5 star review if he actually told you what the volume is set at. I have not found any way to know how high or low the volume is set.
Other then that - terrific sound bar!
131.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

132.author: fred
132.review: It's Bose it going to sound great. Found it hard to hook up to my five year old Sony tv. Had go out and buy a special cable that only Amazon or at the time Radio shack had. A week later the guys a best buy said I should have got a Sony sound system everything would have just paired with no problem. Wish the sells person would have told me that when I brought it. But leased learned
132.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

133.author: Thebronc27
133.review_title: Everything you would expect from Bose
133.review: Have had this bar for about a year now everything work just how it should and just how you would expect, typical Bose quality . The dialogue enhance works awesome for guys like me with bad hearing ,And for anybody who spends only 250$ on a Bose soundbar and complains there isn’t enough bass or it’s not loud enough has no idea what type of systems Bose makes and what true high quality systems focus on (not just Walmart noise) do your research
133.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

134.author: YamKr
134.review:
Bought this sound bar for my new tv. Its fits perfectly in front of my tv. Very good sound. I really love the sound and music. Great buy for those who like to buy a bar. Easy to carry. It also comes with remote control.

There is no sub woofer and HDMI port so you either have to use optical, or AV. You can also use it as a Bluetooth speaker, and that is what I mainly use it for. It is simple to pair, and requires no password. You simply hit the pair button on the remote and connect it via your device. Music came out nice, loud and clear.
134.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

135.author: Mike
135.review: This has very nice sound output more tuned to a smaller room because of its limited volume. Has a good voice lift feature for dialog that can get lost in surrounding sounds. My only con would be it’s a little limited on volume but like I said better tuned for a smaller room. Another plus is that it comes with a full universal remote instead af the small one previous models had.
135.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

136.author: Motorhomegeek
136.review_title: Best sound for a motorhome tv without going surrou
136.review: We purchased a Samsung smart tv to replace our original analog tv. The picture is great but the sound was really bad we had to turn it up all the way and the sound was muffled. We had looked into surround sound systems and were afraid they were just to much for our small space. After talking to a couple of sales reps at Best Buy we purchased the Bose sound bar. It was the right choice not only does our tv now have great sound my I phone music is now my home stereo system. I love how this has worked out for us.
136.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

137.author: BuystheBest
137.review: This is a smaller sized soundbar but with Bose quality! Perfect for tvs in a bedroom or to fit under a smaller tv when you don't want the soundbar to be longer than the tv. I was surprised how much better the sound is with the soundbar. Very nicely designed remote too. It doesn't have as much bass as one with a sub-woofer but I find it's fine for a tv and perfect for a bedroom. It's worth a try; you can always go up in size to the larger Bose if you decide you want to but I have been happy with the Bose quality.
137.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

138.author: DFWGuy
138.review: Bought this to help my 85 YO mother hear voices more clearly on the TV. Definitely has helped with better base and much clearer voices. She can use the TV without the Sub-titles now! Unfortunately, you have to turn it on with a separate remote and then change it to the clear voice setting every time you turn on the TV. The FIOS remote doesn't have a way for me to set this up. OTW its a nice, fairly inexpensive solution. For a non-tech, like my mom it's a problem.
138.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

139.author: Lars
139.review: I live in an apartment and I have had this for a couple of months now and and I don't have too much to complain about. As with most products by Bose, it seems to be pretty well made and has decent sound range without the bass having too much thump and annoying the neighbors. While it will not replace a complete sound system, it is definitely better than the the built in TV speakers on my 43" Visio. I also like the additional Bluetooth functionality.
139.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

140.author: JCB2DAY
140.review: Hooking up was easy. Setting up with the TV was easy. Turned on the TV expecting night and day difference, but there was none. Realizing my TV only has 8 watts of power going to the audio, the Bose sounded good but not amazing like my other Bose products(computer speakers, car stereo). So I returned it for a Samsung 100 watt amplified model which sounds great & is perfect for my bedroom TV. The Solo 5 really needs to add a little power to be effective.
140.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

141.author: ZakNJ
141.review: As someone who has spent of to of time building homes and putting tech in my homes and others This soundbar is as worthless as can be for the price . BOSE customer support by far the worst ive come across in years Ask anyone. They sell based on a name. Bass quality is garbage . Voice controls are subpar same compliants with all bose Vocals are lower . High limit volume is that of a duck When it reaches max you scratch your heas as to why they wouldnt make it louder
141.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

142.author: Ryan
142.review: This is a great little sound bar. I have a very open floor plan and vaulted ceilings so the TV speaker sound would just get lost. This projects the sound with good clarity and surprisingly clean deep bass tones for having no sub. It's not a surround sound, big movie type of system, but for what you pay it's a huge improvement over tv sound and a pretty big leap from anything else in it's price range.
142.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

143.author: Geol
143.review_title: Good Product with the usual small size limitations
143.review: Good product! Reproduces Mid / Hi range sounds with incredible clarity. Bass is lacking, no matter the promises or the doctored in store sample soundtracks. Also, it would be nice if volume level could be displayed on the unit. Just a green light to tell you the unit is on, but you will have no clue if it is quiet, super loud or on mute. You will only know once the sound feed starts. Still wondering if all of this is worth the high price inherent with any Bose system.
143.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

144.author: Amateur
144.review: This was purchased to use with our 42" Sony TV. Since wall mounting it we felt like we were turning it up louder and louder. However, we may just be getting older. It was easy to install though it did take some experimenting and trying a couple different things to get all components to play through it. We struggled to get the bluray to play through it at first. The blue tooth option is nice and was simple to connect to a phone, iPod, and Kindle. I also like the small size. Overall happy with the purchase.
144.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

145.author: Valueseeker
145.review_title: Perfect Sound System for Our Living Room
145.review: Our Bose sound system was purchased to project sound into our living room. We have a flat screen TV with built-in speakers, but the audio was difficult to hear with some programming. Our Bose system is perfect for a 12 ft. x 12 ft. room. The best thing is that the soundbar is not too long (22" wide), and fits perfectly in a 24" opening in our corner TV cabinet. The sound quality is top-notch -- we just watched and listened to a PBS broadcast of the Vienna Philharmonic and the sound was amazing.
145.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

146.author: beerman
146.review_title: Complex sound out of a sound bar!
146.review: I have a couple other sound bars, but this Bose Solo 5 beats them all. It has deep base for movies and everyday TV show watching is also very good since there is a dialog feature to make the voices more clear, especially to someone who has some hearing loss. I like the fact you can use Bluetooth to connect to your phone or other devices like my kid's Fire tablets. Well worth the premium to get the best sound bar for this price range.
146.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

147.author: Drake
147.review_title: Great sound for what it is.
147.review: Like all Bose, the sound is great. I got this Solo 5 to help me hear the dialogue of the tv without blasting my wife out of the room (losing my hearing), and the size was exactly what fit the space. This does an excellent job of that and even has decent surround sound for a small single bar. But, the base is kind of lacking, as expected due to it's size. Still good for movies, but won't knock your socks off on the action scenes. All in all, it's perfect for me and I am once again happy with another Bose purchase.
147.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

148.author: Louie123456789
148.review_title: Wow I am amazed by this small speaker
148.review: I have a bose 130 system for my living room and wanted good sound in my bedroom. I wanted to add a sub but it just wasn't going to be a feasible layout. I looked at the solo 15 but I wouldn't have a spot to put it on. I didn't want to sacrifice sound. When I saw this I had to buy it. I am very impressed from the output of this speaker. It does a good job at handling bass and comes out real clear. Of course it's not a replacement for a sub. I am thinking about getting another one
148.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

149.author: GeoffsDaughter
149.review_title: Excellent sound from a compact soundbar
149.review: I bought this BOSE soundbar after speaking with the Best Buy rep who explained the difference between BOSE sound engineering and the others that offer 2-1 or 3-1 sound systems. The other systems have another speaker that you have to set up across the room from the bar; whereas the BOSE is just the soundbar. It took a bit of time to program the universal remote, but once that was done we've enjoyed the sound quality immensely. Everything sounds clearer and more dynamic. Highly recommend.
149.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

150.author: jmartinez
150.review: I purchased this to use as a Bluetooth speaker and as a tv speaker for my Xbox one. Build quality is a little on the cheaper side, but this is made up for in the sound quality. The additional remote is a fantastic upgrade as well. Optical inputs as well as analog were a perfect fit for the system. This fits very neatly on my desk under the monitor and the sound fills my modest sized room well. Lacks a little punch on bass, but without a sub that's to be expected. Well with the purchase at this price point.
150.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

151.author: Doppler
151.review: The Bose soundbar was a breeze to install, even without reading the instructions. We had been listening to programs from the 55" Samsung internal speakers, so we were "blown away" when we first engaged the Bose. The primary reason for seeking out a solution was to improve the dialogue so that we could actually understand what was being said. The Bose, with it's "dialogue" mode provides the solution for us
151.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

152.author: Geekgirl
152.review_title: Great speaker for a small space
152.review: This is a great speaker for a small space. It was easy to set up and the remote allows you to control your TV. You may still need your TV remote as it doesn't have all the buttons for a smart TV but it works for power and basic channel control. The size is what sold it and not having to deal with a sub woofer. It really improves the sound quality from the TV. The speech feature makes dialog a lot clearer as well.
152.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

153.author: GWol
153.review: This sound bar was compact enough for our bedroom, where we have a 32" Sharp TV. My hearing isn't it used to be, and although the TV speakers were loud enough, there were a lot of shows where I could not follow the dialogue through the background music and sound effects. This Bose speaker makes the voices pop out, has much better bass (as expected) and just sounds great. Very easy to set up and I programmed the included remote control for the TV and my Tivo, so I only need 1 remote for all 3 device.
153.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

154.author: seavarg
154.review: Purchased this sound bar for use with my Vizio 4K TV and I was absolutely blown away! I have not previously invested in Bose home theater systems because the price of entry was just too much for me but this was a fine price point to test the waters. Sound output is phenomenal and I do not lose audio quality when turning the volume up like I did on my Vizio sound base I was originally using. The added functionality of Bluetooth and a universal remote make this the ideal sound bar. Highly Recommended!
154.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

155.author: CanonGeek
155.review: I bought a Solo 5 a few months back, at the recommendation of a friend who always spends the extra change to get the best. Now, it's not audiophile quality, but it's not audiophile price either--and it's a vast improvement over the tv speakers. The voice enhancement is a nice feature, and it doesn't sound unnatural at all. Bottom line--just bought another one for the second tv.
155.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

156.author: Flsunluver
156.review: With the speakers designed on the back of the TV all of the sound kept going to the wall behind instead out front where you need it. I am hearing impaired and was always turning the volume up so loud that the neighbors could hear my TV just as well as I could. With the sound bar the volume is projected outward where I need it and the volume levels can be adjusted just where I need it. The stereo sound makes it like being in a theater. I have already recommended this sound bar to family members and friends.
156.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

157.author: jrk100
157.review: I find Bose has gone to the "Dark Side" with their once respected quality of great sound and product in general. My remote, which is supplied, has not been able to sinc with my new television like promised. Perhaps I made an error in the setup process. Don't know. The volume is not to my satisfaction either. For the price I was expecting better. Perhaps a cheaper sound bar would have been to my liking. Who knows. I should have read some reviews first, but I was already at the store and wanted to purchase at the time.
157.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

158.author: Vol131
158.review: I bought this sound bar because I wanted better sound quality than the TV speakers. Also I've owned Bose products before and you really can't go wrong with them. I especially like this one because it had no subwoofer and I'm just really not that into deep bass. The setup in straightforward and simple. The sound quality and clarity are excellent and representative of what I would expect from a Bose product. And for the quality compared to other sound bars the price was excellent.
158.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

159.author: ScubaSteve
159.review: I love BOSE products. When it comes to audio quality nothing comes close to comparing to my BOSE products. I purchased this sound bar for my new TV, ended up hooking up my phone to play music. I am extremely pleased with the sound quality and the ease in which I was able to set this product up. I will continue to use BOSE for my quality sound products. It made my small apartment feel like I had true surround sound installed.
159.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

160.author: King4ADay
160.review_title: Excellent sound! Thank you again, Bose.
160.review: Went to store after reading reviews. I was a little skeptical at first cause read some people complaining about lack of bass but in my opinion the bass in this little baby is adequate, I was surprise how good it was. The sound is clear, you can hear every single drop, effect, voice. Incredible. Perfect for my room which is small. If you have a large room I suggest you look into the Bose Cinemate 15, The Bose Solo 5 works best for smaller rooms, comes with Universal control. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase.
160.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

161.author: Self
161.review: Sounds good. I don't like that when I connect it bluetooth or wireless it cuts out little at first then constantly.... you would here little music then pause music pause music longer pause etc. However connected with wire to TV works good but sometimes it doesn't keep up with TV and mouths move but we hear it a few seconds later. Overall yes good sound just hate the other stuff...
161.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

162.author: davidklugg
162.review_title: Nice sounding, small speaker for a smaller room
162.review: I like the sound and it was easy to set up with the approved mounts. Now, one complaint is that Best Buy didn't have the mounts and I had to go to the Bose store to get them. My other complaint is I couldn't get Bose's "universal" remote to work with my Samsung TV, so I'm stuck using two remotes. That might be something I figure out later. But the important point is the sound is much cleaner than from the TV itself. So it met my need.
162.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

163.author: BoseSolo5
163.review: Good solution for those, like me, who don't want a speaker array all over the room. The clear voice feature is largely the reason I picked this device, and it works very well. Dialog is much easier to hear clearly with the push of a single button. I've never been disappointed with a Bose device, and this is no exception. And a big bonus is the remote supplied with the Bose, it is easy to program to control TV, cable, and DVD player in addition to the sound bar. Very satisfied with this device.
163.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

164.author: Sandy
164.review: I purchased this for my son and daughter-in-law for their birthdays. They were shopping for a sound bar and we're going to buy a Sony. My husband and I have the Bose sound bar and are totally happy with it, so after hearing that they were going to purchase one, I quickly ordered the Bose for them. My son said they couldn't afford to buy a Bose but they really wanted one! When they received this, they were so happy and after hooking it up to their tv, they are even more in love with it.
164.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

165.author: dannyboy
165.review_title: What can I say it's Bose
165.review: I am hard of hearing and when I saw this unit I figured it would help with TV dialogue and it really does. This is a great unit for a smaller room such as the bedroom which is where I'm using it. I think it would be a little lacking for a large room. I am very impressed by the sound quality and as I mentioned the dialogue is so much clearer than the TV. Great product, but then it's Bose, usually can't go wrong.
165.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

166.author: mkosak
166.review:
This is an incredible TV and I received an amazing bargain price. I returned a sound bar, that was not quite what I wanted, no hassle at all! so I perused through the TV section and found this amazing TV on clearance- and the sound was so good I dont need a sound bar. It also has so many features I found I never use my ROKU device any more.
This picture quality is so good it is like they are standing there in front of you.
166.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

167.author: RK2012
167.review: I recently mounted my Samsung flat screen above the fireplace and ever since the audio was sounding garbled. I was looking for a speaker system that would help with the audio but that did not need a subwoofer. This Bose system was perfect. It was easy to setup and now the audio sounds great. In addition it was he perfect height so it got under my tv with ease. In addition you can play music on it via Bluetooth. This is a great product that I would definitely recommend.
167.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

168.author: Banjo
168.review: We mounted a 37in TV to the wall and wanted a sound bar to provide better audio than the TV speakers. This Bose sound bar delivers! It is small - about 2 feet long and does great in a medium size room. With the 37 in tv, the bar does not appear too small in comparison. The sound bar provides good, deep, rich voices for movies, news, and sports. An added feature is you can pair the speaker to your phone and use the BOSE as an external speaker to play music! A great feature!
168.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

169.author: PMPRO
169.review_title: Good product for a small space
169.review:
A little pricey but delivers on sound quality. I absolutely needed something that could provide much better sound quality for my office TV. The TV speakers were terrible!

I did some research and came across this speaker. Most sound bars were too long and did not fit into the space in the cabinet where my TV was stored. This fit in easily. Sound great and is way better than the TV speakers.
169.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

170.author: LIKEBOSE
170.review: I thought of Buying a 5.1 Sound bar of famous TV Brand. I was under the impression that Bose is over prized. But looking at a Bose Sound bar at a test station in BestBuy I was tempted and bought Bose, though it is small in Size than what I was looking far. And now I am more than Happy after buying it and it took to the new Experience Level of the Watching Series on Netflix.
170.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

171.author: YoAdrian
171.review: Speakers on my TV are bad so I bought this BOSE sound bar. Sound bar does an excellent job being a sound bar and major improvement from my TV speakers. I do not hear any static or unwanted noises from sound bar. Still sounds good when played loud. Not too big, not too expensive, and easy to hook up and use. So far I have no issues. Great sound bar.
171.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

172.author: Ultim8viper
172.review_title: Good Sound Bar But not the Best from Bose
172.review: This is a Good Sound Bar, But not the Best Sound from Bose, I expected more Bass and Volume from a Top Tier Sound Company, I could have gone with a 5.1 Surround Sound System, Which I may return this Item and get the complete set up, I thought that this would have been a better speaker. The only way I found to get a Amplified Sound is to run it through my Xbox One, It may not be much louder than the TV speakers due to the Optical Cable? But I expected more from Bose.
172.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

173.author: rongrantrn
173.review: This sound bar provides better sound that my TV speakers - that's the best thing I can say about it. It is not "great" sound, but it's OK. What I'm really disappointed in is the remote control. I was hoping I could get rid of one or two of my four remotes, but not so. When I went back to the store to discuss it, the associate told me the only way I could do that was to buy another remote (for about $150). I'm not very happy with this purchase.
173.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

174.author: DWBCPA
174.review: The BOSE SOLO 5 Soundbar enhances the sound from my new 55 inch Samsung TV. It was reasonably priced. Note that the remote that comes with the Soundbar after programming can control my TV, Cable Box as well as the Soundbar so I do not need 3 remotes to assist me with my TV watching. I am using it in a room 11 x 10 and I did not want to have over-powering sound. I would say the Bose Solo 5 does a great job for me.
174.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

175.author: Works
175.review: We bought this sound bar with the help of the Best Buy salesperson. We were having trouble understanding the dialog on the TV and wanted something that would help with that. We didn't want to spend a lot of money and didn't need surround sound. This item met our needs. It has a button to enhance dialog which works and we get a good clear sound, better than the TV speakers. Great little sound bar for the price.
175.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

176.author: Hotrod1969
176.review: Bought this for a family member as a gift. They loved it! The sound is nothing short of the great Bose sound. This sound bar was used to make hearing the tv easier. The EC speakers were hard to hear but with this now everything can be heard. It also has a button on the remote for conversation mode where it amplifies the voice to make hard conversations heard easier. Highly recommend this sound bar for the price! Plus it’s easy to hook up!
176.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

177.author: corky
177.review_title: TV not functioning since soundbar installed
177.review: Sales rep did great job of explaining MOST of connection process. . Returned to store with questions about use of soundbar remote. Day after installation, tv (6 mo. old) developed major problems, First could not tun tv off with remote, then couldn't turn ON. Extensive exam by tv service provider, new remote control, tv still not functioning. Still undetermined if connection between soundbar installation and tv operation.
177.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

178.author: Beau
178.review_title: Ok in size & look, but not in sound surprisingly
178.review: For a "name brand" such as Bose, I expected a product unsurpassed in sound and fullness. I have a Bose stereo and CD deck now, and it has a much fuller sound to it. I've had the product in question for approximately 3 weeks now and am planning on taking it back to Best Buy to exchange for another type ... provided of course, that Best Buy will allow me to do that.
178.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

179.author: Jheily
179.review_title: Sound quality was sub par for a BOSE sound system
179.review: I bought this unit for my wife for Christmas, but upon hooking it to our 4K television we were sadly unimpressed with the sound quality. Basically it sounded like our television speakers. I double checked the connections, Optical, pretty straightforward connections, but could not produce a sound worthy of keeping. We may have had a bad unit out of the box, but we decided to go with a different manufacturer that was similar priced.
179.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

180.author: Lostboy
180.review_title: Great Soundbar/Bluetooth Speaker for small areas!
180.review: I bought this for my Ski Condo, I'm a bit of an audio file, and the thought of listening to movies and shows through tv speakers sounded horifing!! :) Since I expect to spend more time snowboarding than watching and because I didn't want my neighbors to hate me the first day (thought I'd give them time for that :). I bought this little guy and boy am I glad it did! Great highs and mid's and even some decent bass! Can't beat it for the price! Wish I had a spot for another one!!
180.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

181.author: gmiles
181.review: This sound bar is sleek and looks good on the TV stand. It sounds good for what I use it for (bedroom), but in my research I found this soundbar to be rated fairly midrange. I mean its good for the price, but I'm going to pay a little more and try the Sonos Beam bc of the Alexa integration. That being said this is still a good soundbar.
181.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

182.author: Furyspectre
182.review: This sound bar is perfect for a smaller or medium sized room. The sad thing is that a lot of people are used to hearing a lot of bass and confuse this product for "not having bass" In reality, this speakers are clear and balanced and offer the proper amount of bass and clarity to make television, movies and gaming much more enjoyable.
182.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

183.author: PTcruiser
183.review: There is a small selection of soundbars under 25" wide. This is a generally good soundbar, but much higher priced than the other ones in the small category. It has a talk show mode and bass reduction which are two of the features why I purchased this for my hearing impaired mother. But neither feature really changes the sound much, if at all. So it would be a good soundbar if you want improvement over the built in TV speakers, but not if you want it for anything else.
183.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

184.author: averagejoe
184.review: I bought this sound bar because like many, I was unable to clearly hear conversations on programs and turning up the volume didn't always help. I didn't want to spend too much, but I also didn't want to forfeit quality either. I was happy to this sound bar by Bose at such a reasonable price. To date I have been extremely happy with the clear sound. The fact that the included remote is also compatible with my Samsung tv and DIRECTV receiver is a nice little bonus.
184.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

185.author: Vishna
185.review: I bought this in-store after trying out several of the other comparable speakers. It was a gift for mother's day, and perfectly suited my mom's needs. She is using it in a mid-sized living room and it has surprising depth and volume for its size. Of course, it does not provide "surround sound"-like effects but it comes pretty close without actually having speakers on the other side of the room. I would recommend this product over the others that I tried.
185.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

186.author: jbutch
186.review: Love this sound bar. We purchased a new TV and knowing that I have problems making out speaking voices and always have to have the sound up so loud, we decided to get a sound bar. After testing several out in the store we hit the jackpot with the Bose. For some reason the voices seem so clear with the Bose Solo 5 and I am able to understand everything that is being said without the volume up so high. The other brands could get loud but the sounds weren't so clear.
186.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

187.author: PJC75
187.review_title: Improved sound - same remote control issues
187.review: Bought this sound bar to improve sound quality of my flat screen HD TV. Definitely did that, especially playing music. Like the bluetooth connectivity of the device - makes it available to more than just the dedicated TV. However, now I have to use 3 so-called universal remotes to watch TV instead of two, or (is it even possible?) one. Programming of the remote does not endure and needs to be reset. When are the manufacturers (I blame them all) gonna get this right?
187.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

188.author: Bree
188.review:
We purchased a new 82" Samsung TV and I wanted a soundbar to connect to it. Of course we went with the brand that we knew, the Bose. It was so easy to set up and work, how can you go wrong with Bose. When the Geek Squad delivered the TV they also connected the Bose soundbar to the universal remote. 
The smaller Bose soundbar has excellent sound and we have a large living room.
188.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

189.author: Nobodey
189.review_title: Good sound in a small package
189.review:
I picked this up just shy of a week and set it up to my Sony Bravia TV. The TV itself had decent enough sound, but this made it sound amazing. I was playing Spotify on it yesterday and it had a rich sound that filled the room. If I had any complaint at all, it was the difficulty in programming my tv with the universal remote that comes with it. The remote itself however is amazing.
I was a little iffy about the price at first, but I have to say it is well worth it!
189.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

190.author: CoffeePerson
190.review: I was looking for a small Soundbar to fit below a shelf that I had to build to set my 50" TV on that sits on top of a fireplace mantel. The cable Hookup and electric outlet had been built into the top of the mantel and the presented a bit of a challenge to make it work. I was able to fit this small Bose Unit into the space and it also helps to conceal the wire hookups and sounds Great. I Especially like the Voice Feature for when you are watching the news etc.
190.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

191.author: Anna
191.review: This is an ideal speaker that is not so big and you guys can wirelessly listen to your fave tv shows to your dvd movies and up to your fave music from your phone all because of the bluetooth connections only!!! We collect Bose sound system because it's a worth buying for! If you guys loves music then you must love Bose' sounds...
191.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

192.author: SusanHagen
192.review: We really liked this soundbar because it was shorter than most other brands (other brands were usually 38") and we didn't need one that wide because it needed to fit on top of our armoire, but be narrow enough to still save space for the DVD player and the cable box. It has great sound but we wish it had a wireless sub. Even though we are using this in the master bedroom for movies and listening to music, we would like a little more bass. Overall though, we are very pleased.
192.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

193.author: Unuthul
193.review: My wife and I had gotten a sizable gift card for Best Buy for Christmas, and wanted a sound bar to go with the 4k tv we got the year before. We had been researching Samsung and LG, because that's what was in our budget. When we saw the demo for the Bose we pressed the button, 30 seconds later we were hooked. It doesn't come with a subwoofer, but doesn't seem to need it. We've heard great sound and have absolutely no complaints about it. Well worth the money.
193.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

194.author: Uncuhpaulie
194.review_title: Not the full-on Bose experience I'm used to...
194.review: Great sounding speaker for the price. Fills up a small bedroom quite well. I enjoy the features like Bluetooth connectivity to my iPhone, as well as the option to go from loud bass to amplifying the movie dialogue instead. I use this feature when watching late at night to keep from disturbing the person in the room right next to mine. Great Bose quality sound; maybe not enough to fill a large living room, but perfect for more confined spaces.
194.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

195.author: fork4949
195.review: I like this sound bar a lot! I tried the Sony sound bar w/subwoofer first, and tho the bar sounded nice it was quite a bit longer and didn't look nice for size n layout of my front room.. so w/that nor did the subwoofer, it hardly made noise and was too big a piece to just be there in the room.. the Bose Solo 5 is perfect!! Sounds great and has bass included which can be adjusted separately from the sound itself.
195.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

196.author: rwlpdx
196.review: I had not planned on purchasing a soundbar but after hearing the difference with it and without it, I decided to upgrade and purchase it. Very happy with it's performance. Easy to connect although i wish the TV remote (Samsung) could control volume and on/off. It doesn't so I do have to use the Bose remote. The remote itself is big and looks like it could be a universal remote but i just don't like big remotes so only use it for on/off and volume control.
196.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

197.author: Toby
197.review_title: Excellent for a smaller entertainment room
197.review: This small sound system has excellent noise discrimination and width for movies or watching the news with the wiring and space required for larger systems. Only one plug in and no worry about where to place the subwoofer (as there is none). I was slightly skeptical on purchasing even though it sounded good in the store thinking, "This is going to be a return!" I'm even more satisfied with this then I was with my bulky 7 speaker, 1 subwoofer I had at my last house.
197.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

198.author: Punkin
198.review: I initially purchased this for the master bedroom. Took it back and purchase the Samsung sound bar after talking to a BB employee. I'm very happy with the Samsung product. However, since I've purchased the Bose Cinemate 120 from BB a year ago and Geek Squad came out to set it up; I knew the sound quality was good. So, I ended up going back to purchase this at a later time for a spare bedroom. Awesome clear sound ! You cannot go wrong with this purchase.
198.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

199.author: andrew
199.review: Good well built soundbar. Easy to set up. If you are looking for bass this is not the soundbar you want. Sound is crisp and volume is pretty good in the high range. Also comes with a universal remote. That only took me a couple of minutes to set up. Follow the directions and you are all set within a half hour or less.
199.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

200.author: ErikT
200.review: At the price point the whole package you get as far as bluetooth capabilities and pretty good sound I was really satisfied with it. There are better sounding options out there, but it fills a niche really well...in particular I used it for a small tv in the kitchen that was lacking in the audio department. The bose is compact and simple to setup and use and for the price is a really good value and does it's job well particularly for this sort of application.
200.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

201.author: Melon
201.review_title: not much improvement in the dialog mode
201.review: I bought this to improve the sound quality on my Sony 40in TV. I wanted better clarity for the spoken words, as opposed to music. The dialogue mode does improve the sound quality but only a very very little bit. I was really hoping for more of an improvement. So it is better than just using the sound system of the TV alone but it's not a whole lot better.
201.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

202.author: JHARV
202.review: I was attracted to this product because of its size (which is perfect for 40" tvs) and the in-store demo. This soundbar sounds great for tv and movies, but I was unimpressed when I streamed music via bluetooth to it. It's not quite worth the $250 price tag to me, the remote is too cumbersome and the actual unit doesn't have any buttons located on it. I am almost as impressed with the sound the Vizio and Insignia soundbars priced at $100 produce.
202.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

203.author: Scott
203.review_title: Great soundbar as expected from Bose
203.review: We love our Bose products and this one is no different. Sure, we could get a better bass quality from a product with a separate subwoofer, but that wasn't what we were looking for in this product. We have this mounted directly under our TV (with Rocketfish soundbar mounting hardware). An added plus, the universal remote allows us to control all of our devices with the Bose remote.
203.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

204.author: Buskimo
204.review:
Very easy to set up, small size makes it less intrusive than other systems.
The dialogue feature is wonderful. You ever have the problem while watching a movie and the dialogue is low so you crank the volume to hear it? Then there's a car chase or something and it rattles your windows? This takes care of that problem by subtly focusing on the dialogue. Works great.
204.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

205.author: Jerry
205.review: Bose solo 5 is a very nice upgrade from your regular tv speakers. It's a basic set up and an entry level sound bar. It comes with everything you need so you don't need to buy any extra cables. You cannot hook any other speakers up to it. For a beginner it is the next best soundbar. The sound and the bass are perfect for that extra volume. You can also stream music from your cell phone via Bluetooth. I hope this review helps.
205.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

206.author: Jdkid3020
206.review: Only have it a 3/5 because I feel that Bose could have had a digital display on it to show what level the volume is at. I also have tried the enhanced voice but it's had to know if it is on or off now. Also don't like that it doesn't sync up with my direct tv remote. Now I have the hassle of programming the bulky bose remote which I haven't gotten around too yet. All in all it works like a sound bar should, great volume for how small it is.
206.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

207.author: Scott28
207.review: Bought this for better sound for a new 50" 4K television. I wasn't expecting much because of its small size, but was very impressed after connecting it. You can hear voices much clearer & there's actually a little bass during action scenes. I would've liked it if Best Buy had a display model to sample, but I live close enough to a store to return if I didn't like it.
207.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

208.author: MichaelK
208.review_title: Great Surround Sound Bar for size/prize
208.review: The Bose Solo 5 TV provides for a great 5.1 surround experience in a small package. Anytime we would watch a show/movie that provided 5.1 surround sound through my stock TV speakers, we could not hear the dialogue because there was not center channel. Now with the Solo TV 5, we can hear the dialogue clearly without constantly turning up the volume and down when there were loud sounds from left/right channels. Great sound bar for price and size.
208.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

209.author: gp1292
209.review:
Did not want a complicated system or extra wires to run. This is simple and to the point. It helps the dialog come through much better than tv speakers. Our tv had the speakers pointing down so everything was muffled. This is perfect until we can get a better system that actually does more in the surround sound department.
